functions.description: Quickly check that the same property across all children of this group is equal to the given value.This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this group, the property will be checked on the group but not its children.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

functions.name: addAll
functions.description: Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this group.`Group.addAll('x', 10)` will add 10 to the child.x value for each child.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to increment, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to increment the property by. If child.x = 10 then addAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

functions.name: subAll
functions.description: Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this group.`Group.subAll('x', 10)` will minus 10 from the child.x value for each child.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to decrement, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to subtract from the property. If child.x = 50 then subAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 10.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

functions.name: multiplyAll
functions.description: Multiplies the given property by the amount on all children in this group.`Group.multiplyAll('x', 2)` will x2 the child.x value for each child.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to multiply, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to multiply the property by. If child.x = 10 then multiplyAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 20.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

functions.name: divideAll
functions.description: Divides the given property by the amount on all children in this group.`Group.divideAll('x', 2)` will half the child.x value for each child.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

functions.name: callAllExists
functions.description: Calls a function, specified by name, on all children in the group who exist (or do not exist).After the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the function on the children to call.

parameters.name: existsValue
parameters.description: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.

functions.name: callbackFromArray
functions.description: Returns a reference to a function that exists on a child of the group based on the given callback array.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The object to inspect.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The array of function names.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: The size of the array (pre-calculated in callAll).

functions.name: callAll
functions.description: Calls a function, specified by name, on all on children.The function is called for all children regardless if they are dead or alive (see callAllExists for different options).After the method parameter and context you can add as many extra parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Name of the function on the child to call. Deep property lookup is supported.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: A string containing the context under which the method will be executed. Set to null to default to the child.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the method.

functions.name: preUpdate
functions.description: The core preUpdate - as called by World.

functions.name: update
functions.description: The core update - as called by World.

functions.name: postUpdate
functions.description: The core postUpdate - as called by World.

functions.name: filter
functions.description: Find children matching a certain predicate.For example:    var healthyList = Group.filter(function(child, index, children) {        return child.health > 10 ? true : false;    }, true);    healthyList.callAll('attack');Note: Currently this will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.description: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.description: If true, only existing can be selected; otherwise all children can be selected and will be passed to the predicate.

returns.description: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

functions.name: forEach
functions.description: Call a function on each child in this group.Additional arguments for the callback can be specified after the `checkExists` parameter. For example,    Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)would invoke `awardBonusGold` function with the parameters `(child, 100, 500)`.Note: This check will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.description: If set only children matching for which `exists` is true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.

functions.name: forEachExists
functions.description: Call a function on each existing child in this group.See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.

functions.name: forEachAlive
functions.description: Call a function on each alive child in this group.See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.

functions.name: forEachDead
functions.description: Call a function on each dead child in this group.See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.

functions.name: sort
functions.description: Sort the children in the group according to a particular key and ordering.Call this function to sort the group according to a particular key value and order.For example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The name of the property to sort on. Defaults to the objects z-depth value.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order ascending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING SORT_ASCENDING}) or descending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_DESCENDING SORT_DESCENDING}).

functions.name: customSort
functions.description: Sort the children in the group according to custom sort function.The `sortHandler` is provided the two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b).It should return -1 if `a > b`, 1 if `a < b` or 0 if `a === b`.

parameters.name: sortHandler
parameters.description: The custom sort function.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context in which the sortHandler is called.

functions.name: ascendingSortHandler
functions.description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The second object being sorted.

functions.name: descendingSortHandler
functions.description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The second object being sorted.

functions.name: iterate
functions.description: Iterates over the children of the group performing one of several actions for matched children.A child is considered a match when it has a property, named `key`, whose value is equal to `value`according to a strict equality comparison.The result depends on the `returnType`:- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL RETURN_TOTAL}:    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. The number of matched children is returned.- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE RETURN_NONE}:    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. No value is returned.- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD RETURN_CHILD}:    The callback, if any, is applied to the *first* matching child and the *first* matched child is returned.    If there is no matching child then null is returned.If `args` is specified it must be an array. The matched child will be assigned to the firstelement and the entire array will be applied to the callback function.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: A child matches if `child[key] === value` is true.

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.description: How to iterate the children and what to return.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. The matched child is supplied as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: The arguments supplied to to the callback; the first array index (argument) will be replaced with the matched child.

returns.description: Returns either an integer (for RETURN_TOTAL), the first matched child (for RETURN_CHILD), or null.

functions.name: getFirstExists
functions.description: Get the first display object that exists, or doesn't exist.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.description: If true, find the first existing child; otherwise find the first non-existing child.

returns.description: The first child, or null if none found.

functions.name: getFirstAlive
functions.description: Get the first child that is alive (`child.alive === true`).This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first alive child, or null if none found.

functions.name: getFirstDead
functions.description: Get the first child that is dead (`child.alive === false`).This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first dead child, or null if none found.

functions.name: getTop
functions.description: Return the child at the top of this group.The top child is the child displayed (rendered) above every other child.

returns.description: The child at the top of the Group.

functions.name: getBottom
functions.description: Returns the child at the bottom of this group.The bottom child the child being displayed (rendered) below every other child.

returns.description: The child at the bottom of the Group.

functions.name: countLiving
functions.description: Get the number of living children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as alive.

functions.name: countDead
functions.description: Get the number of dead children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as dead.

functions.name: getRandom
functions.description: Returns a random child from the group.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Offset from the front of the front of the group (lowest child).

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.description: A random child of this Group.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes the given child from this group.This will dispatch an `onRemovedFromGroup` event from the child (if it has one), and optionally destroy the child.If the group cursor was referring to the removed child it is updated to refer to the next child.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to remove.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on the removed child.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the the child will not dispatch the `onRemovedFromGroup` event.

returns.description: true if the child was removed from this group, otherwise false.

functions.name: moveAll
functions.description: Moves all children from this Group to the Group given.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The new Group to which the children will be moved to.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event for the new Group.

returns.description: The Group to which all the children were moved.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Removes all children from this group, but does not remove the group from its parent.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.

functions.name: removeBetween
functions.description: Removes all children from this group whose index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The index to start removing children from.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: The index to stop removing children at. Must be higher than startIndex. If undefined this method will remove all children between startIndex and the end of the group.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Destroys this group.Removes all children, then removes this group from its parent and nulls references.

parameters.name: destroyChildren
parameters.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.

parameters.name: soft
parameters.description: A 'soft destroy' (set to true) doesn't remove this group from its parent or null the game reference. Set to false and it does.

functions.name: addChild
functions.description: Adds a child to the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to add to the container

returns.description: The child that was added.

functions.name: addChildAt
functions.description: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to add

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to place the child in

returns.description: The child that was added.

functions.name: swapChildren
functions.description: Swaps the position of 2 Display Objects within this container.

functions.name: getChildIndex
functions.description: Returns the index position of a child DisplayObject instance

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject instance to identify

returns.description: The index position of the child display object to identify

functions.name: setChildIndex
functions.description: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child DisplayObject instance for which you want to change the index number

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The resulting index number for the child display object

functions.name: getChildAt
functions.description: Returns the child at the specified index

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get the child from

returns.description: The child at the given index, if any.

functions.name: removeChild
functions.description: Removes a child from the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to remove

returns.description: The child that was removed.

functions.name: removeChildAt
functions.description: Removes a child from the specified index position.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get the child from

returns.description: The child that was removed.

functions.name: removeChildren
functions.description: Removes all children from this container that are within the begin and end indexes.

parameters.name: beginIndex
parameters.description: The beginning position. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: The ending position. Default value is size of the container.

functions.name: getBounds
functions.description: Retrieves the bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

returns.description: The rectangular bounding area

functions.name: getLocalBounds
functions.description: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

returns.description: The rectangular bounding area

functions.name: setStageReference
functions.description: Sets the containers Stage reference. This is the Stage that this object, and all of its children, is connected to.

parameters.name: stage
parameters.description: the stage that the container will have as its current stage reference

functions.name: removeStageReference
functions.description: Removes the current stage reference from the container and all of its children.

functions.name: _renderWebGL
functions.description: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer

functions.name: _renderCanvas
functions.description: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer

functions.name: generateTexture
functions.description:
Useful function that returns a texture of the displayObject object that can then be used to create sprites
This can be quite useful if your displayObject is static / complicated and needs to be reused multiple times.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: The resolution of the texture being generated

parameters.name: scaleMode
parameters.description: See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values

parameters.name: renderer
parameters.description: The renderer used to generate the texture.

returns.description: a texture of the graphics object

functions.name: updateCache
functions.description: Generates and updates the cached sprite for this object.

functions.name: toGlobal
functions.description: Calculates the global position of the display object

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The world origin to calculate from

returns.description: A point object representing the position of this object

functions.name: toLocal
functions.description: Calculates the local position of the display object relative to another point

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The world origin to calculate from

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to calculate the global position from

returns.description: A point object representing the position of this object

functions.name: _renderCachedSprite
functions.description: Internal method.

parameters.name: renderSession
parameters.description: The render session

functions.name: _generateCachedSprite
functions.description: Internal method.

functions.name: _destroyCachedSprite
functions.description: Destroys the cached sprite.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running Game.

members.name: name
members.description: A name for this group. Not used internally but useful for debugging.

members.name: z
members.description: The z-depth value of this object within its parent container/Group - the World is a Group as well.This value must be unique for each child in a Group.

members.name: type
members.description: Internal Phaser Type value.

members.name: physicsType
members.description: The const physics body type of this object.

members.name: alive
members.description: The alive property is useful for Groups that are children of other Groups and need to be included/excluded in checks like forEachAlive.

members.name: exists
members.description: If exists is true the group is updated, otherwise it is skipped.

members.name: ignoreDestroy
members.description: A group with `ignoreDestroy` set to `true` ignores all calls to its `destroy` method.

members.name: pendingDestroy
members.description: A Group is that has `pendingDestroy` set to `true` is flagged to have its destroy method called on the next logic update.You can set it directly to flag the Group to be destroyed on its next update.This is extremely useful if you wish to destroy a Group from within one of its own callbacks or a callback of one of its children.

members.name: classType
members.description: The type of objects that will be created when using {@link Phaser.Group#create create} or {@link Phaser.Group#createMultiple createMultiple}.Any object may be used but it should extend either Sprite or Image and accept the same constructor arguments:when a new object is created it is passed the following parameters to its constructor: `(game, x, y, key, frame)`.

members.name: cursor
members.description: The current display object that the group cursor is pointing to, if any. (Can be set manually.)The cursor is a way to iterate through the children in a Group using {@link Phaser.Group#next next} and {@link Phaser.Group#previous previous}.

members.name: enableBody
members.description: If true all Sprites created by, or added to this group, will have a physics body enabled on them.The default body type is controlled with {@link Phaser.Group#physicsBodyType physicsBodyType}.

members.name: enableBodyDebug
members.description: If true when a physics body is created (via {@link Phaser.Group#enableBody enableBody}) it will create a physics debug object as well.This only works for P2 bodies.

members.name: physicsBodyType
members.description: If {@link Phaser.Group#enableBody enableBody} is true this is the type of physics body that is created on new Sprites.The valid values are {@link Phaser.Physics.ARCADE}, {@link Phaser.Physics.P2}, {@link Phaser.Physics.NINJA}, etc.

members.name: physicsSortDirection
members.description: If this Group contains Arcade Physics Sprites you can set a custom sort direction via this property.It should be set to one of the Phaser.Physics.Arcade sort direction constants: Phaser.Physics.Arcade.SORT_NONEPhaser.Physics.Arcade.LEFT_RIGHTPhaser.Physics.Arcade.RIGHT_LEFTPhaser.Physics.Arcade.TOP_BOTTOMPhaser.Physics.Arcade.BOTTOM_TOPIf set to `null` the Group will use whatever Phaser.Physics.Arcade.sortDirection is set to. This is the default behavior.

members.name: onDestroy
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the group is destroyed.

members.name: cursorIndex
members.description: The current index of the Group cursor. Advance it with Group.next.

members.name: fixedToCamera
members.description: A Group that is fixed to the camera uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera. These are stored in Group.cameraOffset.Note that the cameraOffset values are in addition to any parent in the display list.So if this Group was in a Group that has x: 200, then this will be added to the cameraOffset.x

members.name: cameraOffset
members.description: If this object is {@link Phaser.Group#fixedToCamera fixedToCamera} then this stores the x/y position offset relative to the top-left of the camera view.If the parent of this Group is also `fixedToCamera` then the offset here is in addition to that and should typically be disabled.

members.name: hash
members.description: The hash array is an array belonging to this Group into which you can add any of its children via Group.addToHash and Group.removeFromHash.Only children of this Group can be added to and removed from the hash.This hash is used automatically by Phaser Arcade Physics in order to perform non z-index based destructive sorting.However if you don't use Arcade Physics, or this isn't a physics enabled Group, then you can use the hash to perform your ownsorting and filtering of Group children without touching their z-index (and therefore display draw order)

members.name: _sortProperty
members.description: The property on which children are sorted.

members.name: RETURN_NONE
members.description: A returnType value, as specified in {@link Phaser.Group#iterate iterate} eg.

members.name: RETURN_TOTAL
members.description: A returnType value, as specified in {@link Phaser.Group#iterate iterate} eg.

members.name: RETURN_CHILD
members.description: A returnType value, as specified in {@link Phaser.Group#iterate iterate} eg.

members.name: SORT_ASCENDING
members.description: A sort ordering value, as specified in {@link Phaser.Group#sort sort} eg.

members.name: SORT_DESCENDING
members.description: A sort ordering value, as specified in {@link Phaser.Group#sort sort} eg.

members.name: total
members.description: Total number of existing children in the group.

members.name: length
members.description: Total number of children in this group, regardless of exists/alive status.

members.name: angle
members.description: The angle of rotation of the group container, in degrees.This adjusts the group itself by modifying its local rotation transform.This has no impact on the rotation/angle properties of the children, but it will update their worldTransformand on-screen orientation and position.

members.name: x
members.description: The x coordinate of the group container.You can adjust the group container itself by modifying its coordinates.This will have no impact on the x/y coordinates of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

members.name: y
members.description: The y coordinate of the group container.You can adjust the group container itself by modifying its coordinates.This will have no impact on the x/y coordinates of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

members.name: rotation
members.description: The angle of rotation of the group container, in radians.This will adjust the group container itself by modifying its rotation.This will have no impact on the rotation value of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

members.name: visible
members.description: The visible state of the group. Non-visible Groups and all of their children are not rendered.

members.name: alpha
members.description: The alpha value of the group container.

members.name: children
members.description: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

members.name: width
members.description: The width of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

members.name: height
members.description: The height of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

members.name: position
members.description: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

members.name: scale
members.description: The scale factor of the object.

members.name: transformCallback
members.description:
The transform callback is an optional callback that if set will be called at the end of the updateTransform method and sent two parameters:
This Display Objects worldTransform matrix and its parents transform matrix. Both are PIXI.Matrix object types.
The matrix are passed by reference and can be modified directly without needing to return them.
This ability allows you to check any of the matrix values and perform actions such as clamping scale or limiting rotation, regardless of the parent transforms.

members.name: transformCallbackContext
members.description: The context under which the transformCallback is invoked.

members.name: pivot
members.description: The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around

members.name: hitArea
members.description:
This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.
Setting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

members.name: renderable
members.description: Can this object be rendered

members.name: parent
members.description: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.

members.name: stage
members.description: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

members.name: worldAlpha
members.description: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

members.name: worldTransform
members.description: [read-only] Current transform of the object based on world (parent) factors

members.name: worldPosition
members.description:
The position of the Display Object based on the world transform.
This value is updated at the end of updateTransform and takes all parent transforms into account.

members.name: worldScale
members.description:
The scale of the Display Object based on the world transform.
This value is updated at the end of updateTransform and takes all parent transforms into account.

members.name: worldRotation
members.description:
The rotation of the Display Object, in radians, based on the world transform.
This value is updated at the end of updateTransform and takes all parent transforms into account.

members.name: _sr
members.description: cached sin rotation and cos rotation

members.name: _cr
members.description: cached sin rotation and cos rotation

members.name: filterArea
members.description:
The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation
rather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

members.name: _bounds
members.description: The original, cached bounds of the object

members.name: _currentBounds
members.description: The most up-to-date bounds of the object

members.name: _mask
members.description: The original, cached mask of the object

members.name: _cacheAsBitmap
members.description: Cached internal flag.

members.name: _cacheIsDirty
members.description: Cached internal flag.

members.name: worldVisible
members.description: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

members.name: mask
members.description:
Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.
In PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.
To remove a mask, set this property to null.

members.name: filters
members.description:
Sets the filters for the displayObject.
IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the Canvas renderer.

To remove filters simply set this property to 'null'.

You cannot have a filter and a multiply blend mode active at the same time. Setting a filter will reset
this objects blend mode to NORMAL.

members.name: cacheAsBitmap
members.description:
Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.
This basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.
To remove simply set this property to 'null'

classes.name: Phaser.Plugin
classes.description: This is a base Plugin template to use for any Phaser plugin development.

constructor.name: Plugin
constructor.description: This is a base Plugin template to use for any Phaser plugin development.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The object that owns this plugin, usually Phaser.PluginManager.

functions.name: preUpdate
functions.description: Pre-update is called at the very start of the update cycle, before any other subsystems have been updated (including Physics).It is only called if active is set to true.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Update is called after all the core subsystems (Input, Tweens, Sound, etc) and the State have updated, but before the render.It is only called if active is set to true.

functions.name: render
functions.description: Render is called right after the Game Renderer completes, but before the State.render.It is only called if visible is set to true.

functions.name: postRender
functions.description: Post-render is called after the Game Renderer and State.render have run.It is only called if visible is set to true.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Clear down this Plugin and null out references

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running game.

members.name: parent
members.description: The parent of this plugin. If added to the PluginManager the parent will be set to that, otherwise it will be null.

members.name: active
members.description: A Plugin with active=true has its preUpdate and update methods called by the parent, otherwise they are skipped.

members.name: visible
members.description: A Plugin with visible=true has its render and postRender methods called by the parent, otherwise they are skipped.

members.name: hasPreUpdate
members.description: A flag to indicate if this plugin has a preUpdate method.

members.name: hasUpdate
members.description: A flag to indicate if this plugin has an update method.

members.name: hasPostUpdate
members.description: A flag to indicate if this plugin has a postUpdate method.

members.name: hasRender
members.description: A flag to indicate if this plugin has a render method.

members.name: hasPostRender
members.description: A flag to indicate if this plugin has a postRender method.

classes.name: Phaser.PluginManager
classes.description: The Plugin Manager is responsible for the loading, running and unloading of Phaser Plugins.

constructor.name: PluginManager
constructor.description: The Plugin Manager is responsible for the loading, running and unloading of Phaser Plugins.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: add
functions.description: Add a new Plugin into the PluginManager.The Plugin must have 2 properties: game and parent. Plugin.game is set to the game reference the PluginManager uses, and parent is set to the PluginManager.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.description: The Plugin to add into the PluginManager. This can be a function or an existing object.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Additional arguments that will be passed to the Plugin.init method.

returns.description: The Plugin that was added to the manager.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove a Plugin from the PluginManager. It calls Plugin.destroy on the plugin before removing it from the manager.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.description: The plugin to be removed.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Remove all Plugins from the PluginManager. It calls Plugin.destroy on every plugin before removing it from the manager.

functions.name: preUpdate
functions.description: Pre-update is called at the very start of the update cycle, before any other subsystems have been updated (including Physics).It only calls plugins who have active=true.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Update is called after all the core subsystems (Input, Tweens, Sound, etc) and the State have updated, but before the render.It only calls plugins who have active=true.

functions.name: postUpdate
functions.description: PostUpdate is the last thing to be called before the world render.In particular, it is called after the world postUpdate, which means the camera has been adjusted.It only calls plugins who have active=true.

functions.name: render
functions.description: Render is called right after the Game Renderer completes, but before the State.render.It only calls plugins who have visible=true.

functions.name: postRender
functions.description: Post-render is called after the Game Renderer and State.render have run.It only calls plugins who have visible=true.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Clear down this PluginManager, calls destroy on every plugin and nulls out references.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running game.

members.name: plugins
members.description: An array of all the plugins being managed by this PluginManager.

members.name: _len
members.description: Internal cache var.

members.name: _i
members.description: Internal cache var.

classes.name: Phaser.ScaleManager
classes.description: The ScaleManager object handles the the scaling, resizing, and alignment of theGame size and the game Display canvas.The Game size is the logical size of the game; the Display canvas has size as an HTML element.The calculations of these are heavily influenced by the bounding Parent size which is the computeddimensions of the Display canvas's Parent container/element - the _effective CSS rules of thecanvas's Parent element play an important role_ in the operation of the ScaleManager. The Display canvas - or Game size, depending {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#scaleMode scaleMode} - is updated to best utilize the Parent size.When in Fullscreen mode or with {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#parentIsWindow parentIsWindow} the Parent size is that of the visual viewport (see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#getParentBounds getParentBounds}).Parent and Display canvas containment guidelines:- Style the Parent element (of the game canvas) to control the Parent size and  thus the Display canvas's size and layout.- The Parent element's CSS styles should _effectively_ apply maximum (and minimum) bounding behavior.- The Parent element should _not_ apply a padding as this is not accounted for.  If a padding is required apply it to the Parent's parent or apply a margin to the Parent.  If you need to add a border, margin or any other CSS around your game container, then use a parent element and  apply the CSS to this instead, otherwise you'll be constantly resizing the shape of the game container.- The Display canvas layout CSS styles (i.e. margins, size) should not be altered/specified as  they may be updated by the ScaleManager.

constructor.name: ScaleManager
constructor.description: Create a new ScaleManager object - this is done automatically by {@link Phaser.Game}The `width` and `height` constructor parameters can either be a number which represents pixels or a string that represents a percentage: e.g. `800` (for 800 pixels) or `"80%"` for 80%.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the game. See above.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the game. See above.

functions.name: boot
functions.description: Start the ScaleManager.

functions.name: parseConfig
functions.description: Load configuration settings.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The game configuration object.

functions.name: setupScale
functions.description: Calculates and sets the game dimensions based on the given width and height.This should _not_ be called when in fullscreen mode.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the game.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the game.

functions.name: _gameResumed
functions.description: Invoked when the game is resumed.

functions.name: setGameSize
functions.description: Set the actual Game size.Use this instead of directly changing `game.width` or `game.height`.The actual physical display (Canvas element size) depends on various settings including- Scale mode- Scaling factor- Size of Canvas's parent element or CSS rules such as min-height/max-height;- The size of the Window

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: _Game width_, in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: _Game height_, in pixels.

functions.name: setUserScale
functions.description: Set a User scaling factor used in the USER_SCALE scaling mode.The target canvas size is computed by:    canvas.width = (game.width * hScale) - hTrim    canvas.height = (game.height * vScale) - vTrimThis method can be used in the {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setResizeCallback resize callback}.

parameters.name: hScale
parameters.description: Horizontal scaling factor.

parameters.name: vScale
parameters.description: Vertical scaling factor.

parameters.name: hTrim
parameters.description: Horizontal trim, applied after scaling.

parameters.name: vTrim
parameters.description: Vertical trim, applied after scaling.

functions.name: setResizeCallback
functions.description: Sets the callback that will be invoked before sizing calculations.This is the appropriate place to call {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setUserScale setUserScale} if needing custom dynamic scaling.The callback is supplied with two arguments `scale` and `parentBounds` where `scale` is the ScaleManagerand `parentBounds`, a Phaser.Rectangle, is the size of the Parent element.This callback- May be invoked even though the parent container or canvas sizes have not changed- Unlike {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#onSizeChange onSizeChange}, it runs _before_ the canvas is guaranteed to be updated- Will be invoked from `preUpdate`, _even when_ the game is paused    See {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#onSizeChange onSizeChange} for a better way of reacting to layout updates.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback that will be called each time a window.resize event happens or if set, the parent container resizes.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context in which the callback will be called.

functions.name: signalSizeChange
functions.description: Signals a resize - IF the canvas or Game size differs from the last signal.This also triggers updates on {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#grid grid} (FlexGrid) and, if in a RESIZE mode, `game.state` (StateManager).

functions.name: setMinMax
functions.description: Set the min and max dimensions for the Display canvas._Note:_ The min/max dimensions are only applied in some cases- When the device is not in an incorrect orientation; or- The scale mode is EXACT_FIT when not in fullscreen

parameters.name: minWidth
parameters.description: The minimum width the game is allowed to scale down to.

parameters.name: minHeight
parameters.description: The minimum height the game is allowed to scale down to.

parameters.name: maxWidth
parameters.description: The maximum width the game is allowed to scale up to; only changed if specified.

parameters.name: maxHeight
parameters.description: The maximum height the game is allowed to scale up to; only changed if specified.

functions.name: preUpdate
functions.description: The ScaleManager.preUpdate is called automatically by the core Game loop.

functions.name: pauseUpdate
functions.description: Update method while paused.

functions.name: updateDimensions
functions.description: Update the dimensions taking the parent scaling factor into account.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The new width of the parent container.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The new height of the parent container.

parameters.name: resize
parameters.description: True if the renderer should be resized, otherwise false to just update the internal vars.

functions.name: updateScalingAndBounds
functions.description: Update relevant scaling values based on the ScaleManager dimension and game dimensions,which should already be set. This does not change {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#sourceAspectRatio sourceAspectRatio}.

functions.name: forceOrientation
functions.description: Force the game to run in only one orientation.This enables generation of incorrect orientation signals and affects resizing but does not otherwise rotate or lock the orientation.Orientation checks are performed via the Screen Orientation API, if available in browser. This means it will check your monitororientation on desktop, or your device orientation on mobile, rather than comparing actual game dimensions. If you need to check the viewport dimensions instead and bypass the Screen Orientation API then set: `ScaleManager.compatibility.orientationFallback = 'viewport'`

parameters.name: forceLandscape
parameters.description: true if the game should run in landscape mode only.

parameters.name: forcePortrait
parameters.description: true if the game should run in portrait mode only.

functions.name: classifyOrientation
functions.description: Classify the orientation, per `getScreenOrientation`.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: The orientation string, e.g. 'portrait-primary'.

returns.description: The classified orientation: 'portrait', 'landscape`, or null.

functions.name: updateOrientationState
functions.description: Updates the current orientation and dispatches orientation change events.

returns.description: True if the orientation state changed which means a forced update is likely required.

functions.name: orientationChange
functions.description: window.orientationchange event handler.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The orientationchange event data.

functions.name: windowResize
functions.description: window.resize event handler.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The resize event data.

functions.name: scrollTop
functions.description: Scroll to the top - in some environments. See `compatibility.scrollTo`.

functions.name: refresh
functions.description: The "refresh" methods informs the ScaleManager that a layout refresh is required.The ScaleManager automatically queues a layout refresh (eg. updates the Game size or Display canvas layout)when the browser is resized, the orientation changes, or when there is a detected changeof the Parent size. Refreshing is also done automatically when public properties,such as {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#scaleMode scaleMode}, are updated or state-changing methods are invoked.The "refresh" method _may_ need to be used in a few (rare) situtations when- a device change event is not correctly detected; or- the Parent size changes (and an immediate reflow is desired); or- the ScaleManager state is updated by non-standard means; or- certain {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#compatibility compatibility} properties are manually changed.The queued layout refresh is not immediate but will run promptly in an upcoming `preRender`.

functions.name: updateLayout
functions.description: Updates the game / canvas position and size.

functions.name: getParentBounds
functions.description: Returns the computed Parent size/bounds that the Display canvas is allowed/expected to fill.If in fullscreen mode or without parent (see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#parentIsWindow parentIsWindow}),this will be the bounds of the visual viewport itself.This function takes the {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#windowConstraints windowConstraints} into consideration - if the parent is partially outsidethe viewport then this function may return a smaller than expected size.Values are rounded to the nearest pixel.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The rectangle to update; a new one is created as needed.

returns.description: The established parent bounds.

functions.name: alignCanvas
functions.description: Update the canvas position/margins - for alignment within the parent container.The canvas margins _must_ be reset/cleared prior to invoking this.

parameters.name: horizontal
parameters.description: Align horizontally?

parameters.name: vertical
parameters.description: Align vertically?

functions.name: reflowGame
functions.description: Updates the Game state / size.The canvas margins may always be adjusted, even if alignment is not in effect.

functions.name: reflowCanvas
functions.description: Updates the Display canvas size.The canvas margins may always be adjusted, even alignment is not in effect.

functions.name: resetCanvas
functions.description: "Reset" the Display canvas and set the specified width/height.

parameters.name: cssWidth
parameters.description: The css width to set.

parameters.name: cssHeight
parameters.description: The css height to set.

functions.name: queueUpdate
functions.description: Queues/marks a size/bounds check as needing to occur (from `preUpdate`).

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If true resets the parent bounds to ensure the check is dirty.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Reset internal data/state.

functions.name: setMaximum
functions.description: Updates the width/height to that of the window.

functions.name: setShowAll
functions.description: Updates the width/height such that the game is scaled proportionally.

parameters.name: expanding
parameters.description: If true then the maximizing dimension is chosen.

functions.name: setExactFit
functions.description: Updates the width/height such that the game is stretched to the available size.Honors {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#maxWidth maxWidth} and {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#maxHeight maxHeight} when _not_ in fullscreen.

functions.name: createFullScreenTarget
functions.description: Creates a fullscreen target. This is called automatically as as needed when enteringfullscreen mode and the resulting element is supplied to {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#onFullScreenInit onFullScreenInit}.Use {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#onFullScreenInit onFullScreenInit} to customize the created object.

functions.name: startFullScreen
functions.description: Start the browsers fullscreen mode - this _must_ be called from a user input Pointer or Mouse event.The Fullscreen API must be supported by the browser for this to work - it is not the same as settingthe game size to fill the browser window. See {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#compatibility compatibility.supportsFullScreen} to check if the currentdevice is reported to support fullscreen mode.The {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#fullScreenFailed fullScreenFailed} signal will be dispatched if the fullscreen change request failed or the game does not support the Fullscreen API.

parameters.name: antialias
parameters.description: Changes the anti-alias feature of the canvas before jumping in to fullscreen (false = retain pixel art, true = smooth art). If not specified then no change is made. Only works in CANVAS mode.

parameters.name: allowTrampoline
parameters.description: Internal argument. If `false` click trampolining is suppressed.

returns.description: Returns true if the device supports fullscreen mode and fullscreen mode was attempted to be started. (It might not actually start, wait for the signals.)

functions.name: stopFullScreen
functions.description: Stops / exits fullscreen mode, if active.

returns.description: Returns true if the browser supports fullscreen mode and fullscreen mode will be exited.

functions.name: cleanupCreatedTarget
functions.description: Cleans up the previous fullscreen target, if such was automatically created.This ensures the canvas is restored to its former parent, assuming the target didn't move.

functions.name: prepScreenMode
functions.description: Used to prepare/restore extra fullscreen mode settings.(This does move any elements within the DOM tree.)

parameters.name: enteringFullscreen
parameters.description: True if _entering_ fullscreen, false if _leaving_.

functions.name: fullScreenChange
functions.description: Called automatically when the browser enters of leaves fullscreen mode.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The fullscreenchange event

functions.name: fullScreenError
functions.description: Called automatically when the browser fullscreen request fails;or called when a fullscreen request is made on a device for which it is not supported.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The fullscreenerror event; undefined if invoked on a device that does not support the Fullscreen API.

functions.name: scaleSprite
functions.description: Takes a Sprite or Image object and scales it to fit the given dimensions.Scaling happens proportionally without distortion to the sprites texture.The letterBox parameter controls if scaling will produce a letter-box effect or zoom thesprite until it fills the given values. Note that with letterBox set to false the scaled sprite may spill out over eitherthe horizontal or vertical sides of the target dimensions. If you wish to stop this you can crop the Sprite.

parameters.name: sprite
parameters.description: The sprite we want to scale.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The target width that we want to fit the sprite in to. If not given it defaults to ScaleManager.width.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The target height that we want to fit the sprite in to. If not given it defaults to ScaleManager.height.

parameters.name: letterBox
parameters.description: True if we want the `fitted` mode. Otherwise, the function uses the `zoom` mode.

returns.description: The scaled sprite.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Destroys the ScaleManager and removes any event listeners.This should probably only be called when the game is destroyed.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running game.

members.name: dom
members.description: Provides access to some cross-device DOM functions.

members.name: grid
members.description: _EXPERIMENTAL:_ A responsive grid on which you can align game objects.

members.name: width
members.description: Target width (in pixels) of the Display canvas.

members.name: height
members.description: Target height (in pixels) of the Display canvas.

members.name: minWidth
members.description: Minimum width the canvas should be scaled to (in pixels).Change with {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setMinMax setMinMax}.

members.name: maxWidth
members.description: Maximum width the canvas should be scaled to (in pixels).If null it will scale to whatever width the browser can handle.Change with {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setMinMax setMinMax}.

members.name: minHeight
members.description: Minimum height the canvas should be scaled to (in pixels).Change with {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setMinMax setMinMax}.

members.name: maxHeight
members.description: Maximum height the canvas should be scaled to (in pixels).If null it will scale to whatever height the browser can handle.Change with {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setMinMax setMinMax}.

members.name: offset
members.description: The offset coordinates of the Display canvas from the top-left of the browser window.The is used internally by Phaser.Pointer (for Input) and possibly other types.

members.name: forceLandscape
members.description: If true, the game should only run in a landscape orientation.Change with {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#forceOrientation forceOrientation}.

members.name: forcePortrait
members.description: If true, the game should only run in a portrait Change with {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#forceOrientation forceOrientation}.

members.name: incorrectOrientation
members.description: True if {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#forceLandscape forceLandscape} or {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#forcePortrait forcePortrait} are set and do not agree with the browser orientation.This value is not updated immediately.

members.name: _pageAlignHorizontally
members.description: See {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#pageAlignHorizontally pageAlignHorizontally}.

members.name: _pageAlignVertically
members.description: See {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#pageAlignVertically pageAlignVertically}.

members.name: onOrientationChange
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the orientation changes _or_ the validity of the current orientation changes.The signal is supplied with the following arguments:- `scale` - the ScaleManager object- `prevOrientation`, a string - The previous orientation as per {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#screenOrientation screenOrientation}.- `wasIncorrect`, a boolean - True if the previous orientation was last determined to be incorrect.Access the current orientation and validity with `scale.screenOrientation` and `scale.incorrectOrientation`.Thus the following tests can be done:    // The orientation itself changed:    scale.screenOrientation !== prevOrientation    // The orientation just became incorrect:    scale.incorrectOrientation && !wasIncorrectIt is possible that this signal is triggered after {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#forceOrientation forceOrientation} so the orientationcorrectness changes even if the orientation itself does not change.This is signaled from `preUpdate` (or `pauseUpdate`) _even when_ the game is paused.

members.name: enterIncorrectOrientation
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the browser enters an incorrect orientation, as defined by {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#forceOrientation forceOrientation}.This is signaled from `preUpdate` (or `pauseUpdate`) _even when_ the game is paused.

members.name: leaveIncorrectOrientation
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the browser leaves an incorrect orientation, as defined by {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#forceOrientation forceOrientation}.This is signaled from `preUpdate` (or `pauseUpdate`) _even when_ the game is paused.

members.name: fullScreenTarget
members.description: If specified, this is the DOM element on which the Fullscreen API enter request will be invoked.The target element must have the correct CSS styling and contain the Display canvas.The elements style will be modified (ie. the width and height might be set to 100%)but it will not be added to, removed from, or repositioned within the DOM.An attempt is made to restore relevant style changes when fullscreen mode is left.For pre-2.2.0 behavior set `game.scale.fullScreenTarget = game.canvas`.

members.name: _createdFullScreenTarget
members.description: The fullscreen target, as created by {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#createFullScreenTarget createFullScreenTarget}.This is not set if {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#fullScreenTarget fullScreenTarget} is used and is cleared when fullscreen mode ends.

members.name: onFullScreenInit
members.description: This signal is dispatched when fullscreen mode is ready to be initialized butbefore the fullscreen request.The signal is passed two arguments: `scale` (the ScaleManager), and an object in the form `{targetElement: DOMElement}`.The `targetElement` is the {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#fullScreenTarget fullScreenTarget} element,if such is assigned, or a new element created by {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#createFullScreenTarget createFullScreenTarget}.Custom CSS styling or resets can be applied to `targetElement` as required.If `targetElement` is _not_ the same element as {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#fullScreenTarget fullScreenTarget}:- After initialization the Display canvas is moved onto the `targetElement` for  the duration of the fullscreen mode, and restored to it's original DOM location when fullscreen is exited.- The `targetElement` is moved/re-parented within the DOM and may have its CSS styles updated.The behavior of a pre-assigned target element is covered in {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#fullScreenTarget fullScreenTarget}.

members.name: onFullScreenChange
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the browser enters or leaves fullscreen mode, if supported.The signal is supplied with a single argument: `scale` (the ScaleManager). Use `scale.isFullScreen` to determineif currently running in Fullscreen mode.

members.name: onFullScreenError
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the browser fails to enter fullscreen mode;or if the device does not support fullscreen mode and `startFullScreen` is invoked.The signal is supplied with a single argument: `scale` (the ScaleManager).

members.name: screenOrientation
members.description: The _last known_ orientation of the screen, as defined in the Window Screen Web API.See {@link Phaser.DOM.getScreenOrientation} for possible values.

members.name: scaleFactor
members.description: The _current_ scale factor based on the game dimensions vs. the scaled dimensions.

members.name: scaleFactorInversed
members.description: The _current_ inversed scale factor. The displayed dimensions divided by the game dimensions.

members.name: margin
members.description: The Display canvas is aligned by adjusting the margins; the last margins are stored here.

members.name: bounds
members.description: The bounds of the scaled game. The x/y will match the offset of the canvas element and the width/height the scaled width and height.

members.name: aspectRatio
members.description: The aspect ratio of the scaled Display canvas.

members.name: sourceAspectRatio
members.description: The aspect ratio of the original game dimensions.

members.name: event
members.description: The native browser events from Fullscreen API changes.

members.name: windowConstraints
members.description: The edges on which to constrain the game Display/canvas in _addition_ to the restrictions of the parent container.The properties are strings and can be '', 'visual', 'layout', or 'layout-soft'.- If 'visual', the edge will be constrained to the Window / displayed screen area- If 'layout', the edge will be constrained to the CSS Layout bounds- An invalid value is treated as 'visual'

members.name: compatibility
members.description: Various compatibility settings.A value of "(auto)" indicates the setting is configured based on device and runtime information.A {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#refresh refresh} may need to be performed after making changes.

members.name: _scaleMode
members.description: Scale mode to be used when not in fullscreen.

members.name: parentIsWindow
members.description: If the parent container of the Game canvas is the browser window itself (i.e. document.body),rather than another div, this should set to `true`.The {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#parentNode parentNode} property is generally ignored while this is in effect.

members.name: parentNode
members.description: The _original_ DOM element for the parent of the Display canvas.This may be different in fullscreen - see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#createFullScreenTarget createFullScreenTarget}.This should only be changed after moving the Game canvas to a different DOM parent.

members.name: parentScaleFactor
members.description: The scale of the game in relation to its parent container.

members.name: trackParentInterval
members.description: The maximum time (in ms) between dimension update checks for the Canvas's parent element (or window).Update checks normally happen quicker in response to other events.

members.name: onSizeChange
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the size of the Display canvas changes _or_ the size of the Game changes. When invoked this is done _after_ the Canvas size/position have been updated.This signal is _only_ called when a change occurs and a reflow may be required.For example, if the canvas does not change sizes because of CSS settings (such as min-width)then this signal will _not_ be triggered.Use this to handle responsive game layout options.This is signaled from `preUpdate` (or `pauseUpdate`) _even when_ the game is paused.

members.name: onResize
members.description: The callback that will be called each the parent container resizes.

members.name: onResizeContext
members.description: The context in which the {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#onResize onResize} callback will be called.

members.name: _pendingScaleMode
members.description: Used to retain the scale mode if set from config before Boot.

members.name: _fullScreenRestore
members.description: Information saved when fullscreen mode is started.

members.name: _gameSize
members.description: The _actual_ game dimensions, as initially set or set by {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setGameSize setGameSize}.

members.name: _userScaleFactor
members.description: The user-supplied scale factor, used with the USER_SCALE scaling mode.

members.name: _userScaleTrim
members.description: The user-supplied scale trim, used with the USER_SCALE scaling mode.

members.name: _lastUpdate
members.description: The last time the bounds were checked in `preUpdate`.

members.name: _updateThrottle
members.description: Size checks updates are delayed according to the throttle.The throttle increases to `trackParentInterval` over time and is used to morerapidly detect changes in certain browsers (eg. IE) while providing back-off safety.

members.name: _updateThrottleReset
members.description: The minimum throttle allowed until it has slowed down sufficiently.

members.name: _parentBounds
members.description: The cached result of the parent (possibly window) bounds; used to invalidate sizing.

members.name: _tempBounds
members.description: Temporary bounds used for internal work to cut down on new objects created.

members.name: _lastReportedCanvasSize
members.description: The Canvas size at which the last onSizeChange signal was triggered.

members.name: _lastReportedGameSize
members.description: The Game size at which the last onSizeChange signal was triggered.

members.name: _booted
members.description: ScaleManager booted state.

members.name: EXACT_FIT
members.description: A scale mode that stretches content to fill all available space - see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#scaleMode scaleMode}.

members.name: NO_SCALE
members.description: A scale mode that prevents any scaling - see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#scaleMode scaleMode}.

members.name: SHOW_ALL
members.description: A scale mode that shows the entire game while maintaining proportions - see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#scaleMode scaleMode}.

members.name: RESIZE
members.description: A scale mode that causes the Game size to change - see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#scaleMode scaleMode}.

members.name: USER_SCALE
members.description: A scale mode that allows a custom scale factor - see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#scaleMode scaleMode}.

members.name: boundingParent
members.description: The DOM element that is considered the Parent bounding element, if any.This `null` if {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#parentIsWindow parentIsWindow} is true or if fullscreen mode is entered and {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#fullScreenTarget fullScreenTarget} is specified.It will also be null if there is no game canvas or if the game canvas has no parent.

members.name: scaleMode
members.description:
The scaling method used by the ScaleManager when not in fullscreen.
{@link Phaser.ScaleManager.NO_SCALE}
The Game display area will not be scaled - even if it is too large for the canvas/screen. This mode _ignores_ any applied scaling factor and displays the canvas at the Game size.
{@link Phaser.ScaleManager.EXACT_FIT}
The Game display area will be _stretched_ to fill the entire size of the canvas's parent element and/or screen. Proportions are not mainted.
{@link Phaser.ScaleManager.SHOW_ALL}
Show the entire game display area while _maintaining_ the original aspect ratio.
{@link Phaser.ScaleManager.RESIZE}
The dimensions of the game display area are changed to match the size of the parent container. That is, this mode _changes the Game size_ to match the display size.

Any manually set Game size (see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setGameSize setGameSize}) is ignored while in effect.

{@link Phaser.ScaleManager.USER_SCALE}
The game Display is scaled according to the user-specified scale set by {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setUserScale setUserScale}.

This scale can be adjusted in the {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setResizeCallback resize callback} for flexible custom-sizing needs.

members.name: fullScreenScaleMode
members.description: The scaling method used by the ScaleManager when in fullscreen.See {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#scaleMode scaleMode} for the different modes allowed.

members.name: currentScaleMode
members.description: Returns the current scale mode - for normal or fullscreen operation.See {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#scaleMode scaleMode} for the different modes allowed.

members.name: pageAlignHorizontally
members.description: When enabled the Display canvas will be horizontally-aligned _in the Parent container_ (or {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#parentIsWindow window}).To align horizontally across the page the Display canvas should be added directly to page;or the parent container should itself be horizontally aligned.Horizontal alignment is not applicable with the {@link Phaser.ScaleManager.RESIZE RESIZE} scaling mode.

members.name: pageAlignVertically
members.description: When enabled the Display canvas will be vertically-aligned _in the Parent container_ (or {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#parentIsWindow window}).To align vertically the Parent element should have a _non-collapsible_ height, such that it will maintaina height _larger_ than the height of the contained Game canvas - the game canvas will then be scaled vertically_within_ the remaining available height dictated by the Parent element.One way to prevent the parent from collapsing is to add an absolute "min-height" CSS property to the parent element.If specifying a relative "min-height/height" or adjusting margins, the Parent height must still be non-collapsible (see note)._Note_: In version 2.2 the minimum document height is _not_ automatically set to the viewport/window height.To automatically update the minimum document height set {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#compatibility compatibility.forceMinimumDocumentHeight} to true.Vertical alignment is not applicable with the {@link Phaser.ScaleManager.RESIZE RESIZE} scaling mode.

members.name: isFullScreen
members.description: Returns true if the browser is in fullscreen mode, otherwise false.

members.name: isPortrait
members.description: Returns true if the screen orientation is in portrait mode.

members.name: isLandscape
members.description: Returns true if the screen orientation is in landscape mode.

members.name: isGamePortrait
members.description: Returns true if the game dimensions are portrait (height > width).This is especially useful to check when using the RESIZE scale mode but wanting to maintain game orientation on desktop browsers, where typically the screen orientation will always be landscape regardless of the browser viewport.

members.name: isGameLandscape
members.description: Returns true if the game dimensions are landscape (width > height).This is especially useful to check when using the RESIZE scale mode but wanting to maintain game orientation on desktop browsers, where typically the screen orientation will always be landscape regardless of the browser viewport.

classes.name: Phaser.Signal
classes.description: A Signal is an event dispatch mechanism that supports broadcasting to multiple listeners.Event listeners are uniquely identified by the listener/callback function and the context.

constructor.name: Signal
constructor.description: A Signal is an event dispatch mechanism that supports broadcasting to multiple listeners.Event listeners are uniquely identified by the listener/callback function and the context.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: Signal handler function.

parameters.name: fnName
parameters.description: Function name.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: Signal handler function.

parameters.name: isOnce
parameters.description: Should the listener only be called once?

parameters.name: listenerContext
parameters.description: The context under which the listener is invoked.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The priority level of the event listener. Listeners with higher priority will be executed before listeners with lower priority. Listeners with same priority level will be executed at the same order as they were added. (default = 0).

returns.description: An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.

parameters.name: binding
parameters.description: An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: Signal handler function.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Signal handler function.

returns.description: The index of the listener within the private bindings array.

functions.name: has
functions.description: Check if a specific listener is attached.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: Signal handler function.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context on which listener will be executed (object that should represent the `this` variable inside listener function).

returns.description: If Signal has the specified listener.

functions.name: add
functions.description: Add an event listener for this signal.An event listener is a callback with a related context and priority.You can optionally provide extra arguments which will be passed to the callback after any internal parameters.For example: `Phaser.Key.onDown` when dispatched will send the Phaser.Key object that caused the signal as the first parameter.Any arguments you've specified after `priority` will be sent as well:`fireButton.onDown.add(shoot, this, 0, 'lazer', 100);`When onDown dispatches it will call the `shoot` callback passing it: `Phaser.Key, 'lazer', 100`.Where the first parameter is the one that Key.onDown dispatches internally and 'lazer', and the value 100 were the custom arguments given in the call to 'add'.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: The function to call when this Signal is dispatched.

parameters.name: listenerContext
parameters.description: The context under which the listener will be executed (i.e. the object that should represent the `this` variable).

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The priority level of the event listener. Listeners with higher priority will be executed before listeners with lower priority. Listeners with same priority level will be executed at the same order as they were added (default = 0)

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback (listener) function. They will be appended after any arguments usually dispatched.

returns.description: An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.

functions.name: addOnce
functions.description: Add a one-time listener - the listener is automatically removed after the first execution.If there is as {@link Phaser.Signal#memorize memorized} event then it will be dispatched andthe listener will be removed immediately.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: The function to call when this Signal is dispatched.

parameters.name: listenerContext
parameters.description: The context under which the listener will be executed (i.e. the object that should represent the `this` variable).

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The priority level of the event listener. Listeners with higher priority will be executed before listeners with lower priority. Listeners with same priority level will be executed at the same order as they were added (default = 0)

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback (listener) function. They will be appended after any arguments usually dispatched.

returns.description: An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove a single event listener.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: Handler function that should be removed.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Execution context (since you can add the same handler multiple times if executing in a different context).

returns.description: Listener handler function.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Remove all event listeners.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: If specified only listeners for the given context will be removed.

functions.name: getNumListeners
functions.description: Gets the total number of listeners attached to this Signal.

returns.description: Number of listeners attached to the Signal.

functions.name: halt
