parameters.description: The DOM event.buttons property.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The DOM event.

functions.name: processButtonsUp
functions.description: Called by updateButtons.

parameters.name: buttons
parameters.description: The DOM event.buttons property.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The DOM event.

functions.name: updateButtons
functions.description: Called when the event.buttons property changes from zero.Contains a button bitmask.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The DOM event.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Called when the Pointer is pressed onto the touchscreen.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The DOM event from the browser.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Called by the Input Manager.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Called when the Pointer is moved.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event passed up from the input handler.

parameters.name: fromClick
parameters.description: Was this called from the click event?

functions.name: processInteractiveObjects
functions.description: Process all interactive objects to find out which ones were updated in the recent Pointer move.

parameters.name: fromClick
parameters.description: Was this called from the click event?

returns.description: True if this method processes an object (i.e. a Sprite becomes the Pointers currentTarget), otherwise false.

functions.name: leave
functions.description: Called when the Pointer leaves the target area.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event passed up from the input handler.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Called when the Pointer leaves the touchscreen.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event passed up from the input handler.

functions.name: justPressed
functions.description: The Pointer is considered justPressed if the time it was pressed onto the touchscreen or clicked is less than justPressedRate.Note that calling justPressed doesn't reset the pressed status of the Pointer, it will return `true` for as long as the duration is valid.If you wish to check if the Pointer was pressed down just once then see the Sprite.events.onInputDown event.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The time to check against. If none given it will use InputManager.justPressedRate.

returns.description: true if the Pointer was pressed down within the duration given.

functions.name: justReleased
functions.description: The Pointer is considered justReleased if the time it left the touchscreen is less than justReleasedRate.Note that calling justReleased doesn't reset the pressed status of the Pointer, it will return `true` for as long as the duration is valid.If you wish to check if the Pointer was released just once then see the Sprite.events.onInputUp event.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The time to check against. If none given it will use InputManager.justReleasedRate.

returns.description: true if the Pointer was released within the duration given.

functions.name: addClickTrampoline
functions.description: Add a click trampoline to this pointer.A click trampoline is a callback that is run on the DOM 'click' event; this is primarilyneeded with certain browsers (ie. IE11) which restrict some actions like requestFullscreento the DOM 'click' event and rejects it for 'pointer*' and 'mouse*' events.This is used internally by the ScaleManager; click trampoline usage is uncommon.Click trampolines can only be added to pointers that are currently down.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the trampoline; must be unique among active trampolines in this pointer.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback to run/trampoline.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: Context of the callback.

parameters.name: callbackArgs
parameters.description: Additional callback args, if any. Supplied as an array.

functions.name: processClickTrampolines
functions.description: Fire all click trampolines for which the pointers are still referring to the registered object.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets the Pointer properties. Called by InputManager.reset when you perform a State change.

functions.name: resetMovement
functions.description: Resets the movementX and movementY properties. Use in your update handler after retrieving the values.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running game.

members.name: id
members.description: The ID of the Pointer object within the game. Each game can have up to 10 active pointers.

members.name: type
members.description: The const type of this object.

members.name: exists
members.description: A Pointer object that exists is allowed to be checked for physics collisions and overlaps.

members.name: identifier
members.description: The identifier property of the Pointer as set by the DOM event when this Pointer is started.

members.name: pointerId
members.description: The pointerId property of the Pointer as set by the DOM event when this Pointer is started. The browser can and will recycle this value.

members.name: target
members.description: The target property of the Pointer as set by the DOM event when this Pointer is started.

members.name: button
members.description: The button property of the most recent DOM event when this Pointer is started.You should not rely on this value for accurate button detection, instead use the Pointer properties`leftButton`, `rightButton`, `middleButton` and so on.

members.name: leftButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its left button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.

members.name: middleButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its middle button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: rightButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its right button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: backButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its X1 (back) button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: forwardButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Mouse or Pen / Stylus then you can access its X2 (forward) button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: eraserButton
members.description: If this Pointer is a Pen / Stylus then you can access its eraser button directly through this property.The DeviceButton has its own properties such as `isDown`, `duration` and methods like `justReleased` for more fine-grainedbutton control.Please see the DeviceButton docs for details on browser button limitations.

members.name: _holdSent
members.description: Local private variable to store the status of dispatching a hold event.

members.name: _history
members.description: Local private variable storing the short-term history of pointer movements.

members.name: _nextDrop
members.description: Local private variable storing the time at which the next history drop should occur.

members.name: _stateReset
members.description: Monitor events outside of a state reset loop.

members.name: withinGame
members.description: true if the Pointer is over the game canvas, otherwise false.

members.name: clientX
members.description: The horizontal coordinate of the Pointer within the application's client area at which the event occurred (as opposed to the coordinates within the page).

members.name: clientY
members.description: The vertical coordinate of the Pointer within the application's client area at which the event occurred (as opposed to the coordinates within the page).

members.name: pageX
members.description: The horizontal coordinate of the Pointer relative to whole document.

members.name: pageY
members.description: The vertical coordinate of the Pointer relative to whole document.

members.name: screenX
members.description: The horizontal coordinate of the Pointer relative to the screen.

members.name: screenY
members.description: The vertical coordinate of the Pointer relative to the screen.

members.name: rawMovementX
members.description: The horizontal raw relative movement of the Pointer in pixels since last event.

members.name: rawMovementY
members.description: The vertical raw relative movement of the Pointer in pixels since last event.

members.name: movementX
members.description: The horizontal processed relative movement of the Pointer in pixels since last event.

members.name: movementY
members.description: The vertical processed relative movement of the Pointer in pixels since last event.

members.name: x
members.description: The horizontal coordinate of the Pointer. This value is automatically scaled based on the game scale.

members.name: y
members.description: The vertical coordinate of the Pointer. This value is automatically scaled based on the game scale.

members.name: isMouse
members.description: If the Pointer is a mouse or pen / stylus this is true, otherwise false.

members.name: isDown
members.description: If the Pointer is touching the touchscreen, or *any* mouse or pen button is held down, isDown is set to true.If you need to check a specific mouse or pen button then use the button properties, i.e. Pointer.rightButton.isDown.

members.name: isUp
members.description: If the Pointer is not touching the touchscreen, or *all* mouse or pen buttons are up, isUp is set to true.If you need to check a specific mouse or pen button then use the button properties, i.e. Pointer.rightButton.isUp.

members.name: timeDown
members.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer first touched the touchscreen.

members.name: timeUp
members.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer left the touchscreen.

members.name: previousTapTime
members.description: A timestamp representing when the Pointer was last tapped or clicked.

members.name: totalTouches
members.description: The total number of times this Pointer has been touched to the touchscreen.

members.name: msSinceLastClick
members.description: The number of milliseconds since the last click or touch event.

members.name: targetObject
members.description: The Game Object this Pointer is currently over / touching / dragging.

members.name: active
members.description: An active pointer is one that is currently pressed down on the display. A Mouse is always active.

members.name: dirty
members.description: A dirty pointer needs to re-poll any interactive objects it may have been over, regardless if it has moved or not.

members.name: position
members.description: A Phaser.Point object containing the current x/y values of the pointer on the display.

members.name: positionDown
members.description: A Phaser.Point object containing the x/y values of the pointer when it was last in a down state on the display.

members.name: positionUp
members.description: A Phaser.Point object containing the x/y values of the pointer when it was last released.

members.name: circle
members.description: A Phaser.Circle that is centered on the x/y coordinates of this pointer, useful for hit detection.The Circle size is 44px (Apples recommended "finger tip" size).

members.name: _clickTrampolines
members.description: Click trampolines associated with this pointer. See `addClickTrampoline`.

members.name: _trampolineTargetObject
members.description: When the Pointer has click trampolines the last target object is stored hereso it can be used to check for validity of the trampoline in a post-Up/'stop'.

members.name: NO_BUTTON
members.description: No buttons at all.

members.name: LEFT_BUTTON
members.description: The Left Mouse button, or in PointerEvent devices a Touch contact or Pen contact.

members.name: RIGHT_BUTTON
members.description: The Right Mouse button, or in PointerEvent devices a Pen contact with a barrel button.

members.name: MIDDLE_BUTTON
members.description: The Middle Mouse button.

members.name: BACK_BUTTON
members.description: The X1 button. This is typically the mouse Back button, but is often reconfigured.On Linux (GTK) this is unsupported. On Windows if advanced pointer software (such as IntelliPoint) is installed this doesn't register.

members.name: FORWARD_BUTTON
members.description: The X2 button. This is typically the mouse Forward button, but is often reconfigured.On Linux (GTK) this is unsupported. On Windows if advanced pointer software (such as IntelliPoint) is installed this doesn't register.

members.name: ERASER_BUTTON
members.description: The Eraser pen button on PointerEvent supported devices only.

members.name: duration
members.description: How long the Pointer has been depressed on the touchscreen or *any* of the mouse buttons have been held down.If not currently down it returns -1.If you need to test a specific mouse or pen button then access the buttons directly, i.e. `Pointer.rightButton.duration`.

members.name: worldX
members.description: Gets the X value of this Pointer in world coordinates based on the world camera.

members.name: worldY
members.description: Gets the Y value of this Pointer in world coordinates based on the world camera.

classes.name: Phaser.Touch
classes.description: Phaser.Touch handles touch events with your game. Note: Android 2.x only supports 1 touch event at once, no multi-touch.You should not normally access this class directly, but instead use a Phaser.Pointer object which normalises all game input for you.

constructor.name: Touch
constructor.description: Phaser.Touch handles touch events with your game. Note: Android 2.x only supports 1 touch event at once, no multi-touch.You should not normally access this class directly, but instead use a Phaser.Pointer object which normalises all game input for you.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Starts the event listeners running.

functions.name: consumeTouchMove
functions.description: Consumes all touchmove events on the document (only enable this if you know you need it!).

functions.name: addTouchLockCallback
functions.description: Adds a callback that is fired when a browser touchstart event is received.This is used internally to handle audio and video unlocking on mobile devices.If the callback returns 'true' then the callback is automatically deleted once invoked.The callback is added to the Phaser.Touch.touchLockCallbacks array and should be removed with Phaser.Touch.removeTouchLockCallback.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback that will be called when a touchstart event is received.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context in which the callback will be called.

functions.name: removeTouchLockCallback
functions.description: Removes the callback at the defined index from the Phaser.Touch.touchLockCallbacks array

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback to be removed.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context in which the callback exists.

returns.description: True if the callback was deleted, otherwise false.

functions.name: onTouchStart
functions.description: The internal method that handles the touchstart event from the browser.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

functions.name: onTouchCancel
functions.description: Touch cancel - touches that were disrupted (perhaps by moving into a plugin or browser chrome).Occurs for example on iOS when you put down 4 fingers and the app selector UI appears.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

functions.name: onTouchEnter
functions.description: For touch enter and leave its a list of the touch points that have entered or left the target.Doesn't appear to be supported by most browsers on a canvas element yet.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

functions.name: onTouchLeave
functions.description: For touch enter and leave its a list of the touch points that have entered or left the target.Doesn't appear to be supported by most browsers on a canvas element yet.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

functions.name: onTouchMove
functions.description: The handler for the touchmove events.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

functions.name: onTouchEnd
functions.description: The handler for the touchend events.

classes.name: Phaser.Cache
classes.description: Phaser has one single cache in which it stores all assets.The cache is split up into sections, such as images, sounds, video, json, etc. All assets are stored usinga unique string-based key as their identifier. Assets stored in different areas of the cache can have thesame key, for example 'playerWalking' could be used as the key for both a sprite sheet and an audio file,because they are unique data types.The cache is automatically populated by the Phaser.Loader. When you use the loader to pull in external assetssuch as images they are automatically placed into their respective cache. Most common Game Objects, such asSprites and Videos automatically query the cache to extract the assets they need on instantiation.You can access the cache from within a State via `this.cache`. From here you can call any public method it has,including adding new entries to it, deleting them or querying them.Understand that almost without exception when you get an item from the cache it will return a reference to theitem stored in the cache, not a copy of it. Therefore if you retrieve an item and then modify it, the originalobject in the cache will also be updated, even if you don't put it back into the cache again.By default when you change State the cache is _not_ cleared, although there is an option to clear it shouldyour game require it. In a typical game set-up the cache is populated once after the main game has loaded andthen used as an asset store.

constructor.name: Cache
constructor.description: Phaser has one single cache in which it stores all assets.The cache is split up into sections, such as images, sounds, video, json, etc. All assets are stored usinga unique string-based key as their identifier. Assets stored in different areas of the cache can have thesame key, for example 'playerWalking' could be used as the key for both a sprite sheet and an audio file,because they are unique data types.The cache is automatically populated by the Phaser.Loader. When you use the loader to pull in external assetssuch as images they are automatically placed into their respective cache. Most common Game Objects, such asSprites and Videos automatically query the cache to extract the assets they need on instantiation.You can access the cache from within a State via `this.cache`. From here you can call any public method it has,including adding new entries to it, deleting them or querying them.Understand that almost without exception when you get an item from the cache it will return a reference to theitem stored in the cache, not a copy of it. Therefore if you retrieve an item and then modify it, the originalobject in the cache will also be updated, even if you don't put it back into the cache again.By default when you change State the cache is _not_ cleared, although there is an option to clear it shouldyour game require it. In a typical game set-up the cache is populated once after the main game has loaded andthen used as an asset store.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: addCanvas
functions.description: Add a new canvas object in to the cache.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The Canvas DOM element.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context of the canvas element. If not specified it will default go `getContext('2d')`.

functions.name: addImage
functions.description: Adds an Image file into the Cache. The file must have already been loaded, typically via Phaser.Loader, but can also have been loaded into the DOM.If an image already exists in the cache with the same key then it is removed and destroyed, and the new image inserted in its place.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Extra image data.

returns.description: The full image object that was added to the cache.

functions.name: addDefaultImage
functions.description: Adds a default image to be used in special cases such as WebGL Filters.It uses the special reserved key of `__default`.This method is called automatically when the Cache is created.This image is skipped when `Cache.destroy` is called due to its internal requirements.

functions.name: addMissingImage
functions.description: Adds an image to be used when a key is wrong / missing.It uses the special reserved key of `__missing`.This method is called automatically when the Cache is created.This image is skipped when `Cache.destroy` is called due to its internal requirements.

functions.name: addSound
functions.description: Adds a Sound file into the Cache. The file must have already been loaded, typically via Phaser.Loader.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Extra sound data.

parameters.name: webAudio
parameters.description: True if the file is using web audio.

parameters.name: audioTag
parameters.description: True if the file is using legacy HTML audio.

parameters.description: The BitmapData object to be addded to the cache.

parameters.name: frameData
parameters.description: Optional FrameData set associated with the given BitmapData. If not specified (or `undefined`) a new FrameData object is created containing the Bitmap's Frame. If `null` is supplied then no FrameData will be created.

returns.description: The BitmapData object to be addded to the cache.

parameters.name: key

returns.description: True if the sound is decoded and the device is not touch locked.

parameters.description: The cache to search. One of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE` or `Phaser.Cache.SOUND`.

parameters.description: The key of the asset within the cache.

returns.description: True if the key exists, otherwise false.

functions.name: checkURL
functions.description: Checks if the given URL has been loaded into the Cache.This method will only work if Cache.autoResolveURL was set to `true` before any preloading took place.The method will make a DOM src call to the URL given, so please be aware of this for certain file types, such as Sound files on Firefoxwhich may cause double-load instances.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url to check for in the cache.

returns.description: True if the url exists, otherwise false.

parameters.description: The key of the asset within the cache.

returns.description: True if the key exists in the cache, otherwise false.

functions.name: checkImageKey
functions.description: Checks if the given key exists in the Image Cache. Note that this also includes Texture Atlases, Sprite Sheets and Retro Fonts.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset within the cache.

returns.description: True if the key exists in the cache, otherwise false.

functions.name: getItem
functions.description: Get an item from a cache based on the given key and property.This method is mostly used internally by other Cache methods such as `getImage` but is exposedpublicly for your own use as well.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset within the cache.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: The cache to search. One of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE` or `Phaser.Cache.SOUND`.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The string name of the method calling getItem. Can be empty, in which case no console warning is output.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: If you require a specific property from the cache item, specify it here.

returns.description: The cached item if found, otherwise `null`. If the key is invalid and `method` is set then a console.warn is output.

functions.name: getCanvas
functions.description: Gets a Canvas object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The canvas object or `null` if no item could be found matching the given key.

functions.name: getImage
functions.description: Gets a Image object from the cache. This returns a DOM Image object, not a Phaser.Image object.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.Only the Image cache is searched, which covers images loaded via Loader.image, Sprite Sheets and Texture Atlases.If you need the image used by a bitmap font or similar then please use those respective 'get' methods.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache. If not given or null it will return a default image. If given but not found in the cache it will throw a warning and return the missing image.

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: If true the full image object will be returned, if false just the HTML Image object is returned.

returns.description: The Image object if found in the Cache, otherwise `null`. If `full` was true then a JavaScript object is returned.

functions.name: getTextureFrame
functions.description: Get a single texture frame by key.You'd only do this to get the default Frame created for a non-atlas / spritesheet image.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The frame data.

functions.name: getSound
functions.description: Gets a Phaser.Sound object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The sound object.

functions.name: getSoundData
functions.description: Gets a raw Sound data object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The sound data.

functions.name: getText
functions.description: Gets a Text object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The text data.

functions.name: getPhysicsData
functions.description: Gets a Physics Data object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.You can get either the entire data set, a single object or a single fixture of an object from it.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: If specified it will return just the physics object that is part of the given key, if null it will return them all.

parameters.name: fixtureKey
parameters.description: Fixture key of fixture inside an object. This key can be set per fixture with the Phaser Exporter.

returns.description: The requested physics object data if found.

functions.name: getTilemapData
functions.description: Gets a raw Tilemap data object from the cache. This will be in either CSV or JSON format.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The raw tilemap data in CSV or JSON format.

functions.name: getBinary
functions.description: Gets a binary object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The binary data object.

functions.name: getBitmapData
functions.description: Gets a BitmapData object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The requested BitmapData object if found, or null if not.

functions.name: getBitmapFont
functions.description: Gets a Bitmap Font object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The requested BitmapFont object if found, or null if not.

functions.name: getJSON
functions.description: Gets a JSON object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.You can either return the object by reference (the default), or return a cloneof it by setting the `clone` argument to `true`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

parameters.name: clone
parameters.description: Return a clone of the original object (true) or a reference to it? (false)

returns.description: The JSON object.

functions.name: getXML
functions.description: Gets an XML object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The XML object.

functions.name: getVideo
functions.description: Gets a Phaser.Video object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The video object.

functions.name: getShader
functions.description: Gets a fragment shader object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key

returns.description: The shader object.

functions.name: getRenderTexture
functions.description: Gets a RenderTexture object from the cache.The object is looked-up based on the key given.Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.

returns.description: The object with Phaser.RenderTexture and Phaser.Frame.

functions.name: getBaseTexture

parameters.name: key

parameters.name: cache

returns.description: The frame data.

returns.description: Then number of frames. 0 if the image is not found.

functions.name: getFrameData

parameters.name: key

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: The cache to search for the item in.

returns.description: The frame data.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Asset key of the frame data to retrieve from the Cache.

parameters.name: cache

returns.description: True if the given key has frameData in the cache, otherwise false.

functions.description: Replaces a set of frameData with a new Phaser.FrameData object.

parameters.name: key

parameters.name: frameData

parameters.name: cache

functions.name: getFrameByName
functions.description: Get a single frame out of a frameData set by key.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Asset key of the frame data to retrieve from the Cache.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the frame you want to get.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: The cache to search. One of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE` or `Phaser.Cache.SOUND`.

returns.description: The frame object.

functions.name: getPixiTexture
functions.description: Gets a PIXI.Texture by key from the PIXI.TextureCache.If the texture isn't found in the cache, then it searches the Phaser Image Cache andcreates a new PIXI.Texture object which is then returned.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Asset key of the Texture to retrieve from the Cache.

returns.description: The Texture object.

functions.name: getPixiBaseTexture
functions.description: Gets a PIXI.BaseTexture by key from the PIXI.BaseTextureCache.If the texture isn't found in the cache, then it searches the Phaser Image Cache.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Asset key of the BaseTexture to retrieve from the Cache.

returns.description: The BaseTexture object or null if not found.

functions.name: getURL
functions.description: Get a cached object by the URL.This only returns a value if you set Cache.autoResolveURL to `true` *before* starting the preload of any assets.Be aware that every call to this function makes a DOM src query, so use carefully and double-check for implications in your target browsers/devices.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url for the object loaded to get from the cache.

returns.description: The cached object.

functions.name: getKeys
functions.description: Gets all keys used in the requested Cache.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: The Cache you wish to get the keys from. Can be any of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE`, `Phaser.Cache.SOUND` etc.

returns.description: The array of keys in the requested cache.

functions.name: removeCanvas
functions.description: Removes a canvas from the cache.Note that this only removes it from the Phaser.Cache. If you still have references to the data elsewherethen it will persist in memory.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.

functions.name: removeImage
functions.description: Removes an image from the cache.You can optionally elect to destroy it as well. This calls BaseTexture.destroy on it.Note that this only removes it from the Phaser and PIXI Caches. If you still have references to the data elsewherethen it will persist in memory.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.

parameters.name: removeFromPixi
parameters.description: Should this image also be destroyed? Removing it from the PIXI.BaseTextureCache?

functions.name: removeSound
functions.description: Removes a sound from the cache.If any `Phaser.Sound` objects use the audio file in the cache that you remove with this method, they will_automatically_ destroy themselves. If you wish to have full control over when Sounds are destroyed thenyou must finish your house-keeping and destroy them all yourself first, before calling this method.Note that this only removes it from the Phaser.Cache. If you still have references to the data elsewherethen it will persist in memory.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.

functions.name: clearGLTextures

functions.name: _resolveURL
functions.description: Resolves a URL to its absolute form and stores it in Cache._urlMap as long as Cache.autoResolveURL is set to `true`.This is then looked-up by the Cache.getURL and Cache.checkURL calls.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to resolve. This is appended to Loader.baseURL.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data associated with the URL to be stored to the URL Map.

returns.description: The resolved URL.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Clears the cache. Removes every local cache object reference.If an object in the cache has a `destroy` method it will also be called.
