returns.description: true if the given domain fragment can be found in the window.location.hostname

functions.name: updateQueryString
functions.description: Updates a value on the Query String and returns it in full.If the value doesn't already exist it is set.If the value exists it is replaced with the new value given. If you don't provide a new value it is removed from the query string.Optionally you can redirect to the new url, or just return it as a string.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The querystring key to update.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value to be set. If it already exists it will be replaced.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description: If true the browser will issue a redirect to the url with the new querystring.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to modify. If none is given it uses window.location.href.

returns.description: If redirect is false then the modified url and query string is returned.

functions.name: getQueryString
functions.description: Returns the Query String as an object.If you specify a parameter it will return just the value of that parameter, should it exist.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: If specified this will return just the value for that key.

returns.description: An object containing the key value pairs found in the query string or just the value if a parameter was given.

functions.name: decodeURI
functions.description: Returns the Query String as an object.If you specify a parameter it will return just the value of that parameter, should it exist.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The URI component to be decoded.

returns.description: The decoded value.

classes.name: Phaser.Particles.Arcade
classes.description: Arcade Particles is a Particle System integrated with Arcade Physics.

constructor.name: Arcade
constructor.description: Arcade Particles is a Particle System integrated with Arcade Physics.

classes.name: Phaser.Particles.Arcade.Emitter
classes.description: Emitter is a lightweight particle emitter that uses Arcade Physics.It can be used for one-time explosions or for continuous effects like rain and fire.All it really does is launch Particle objects out at set intervals, and fixes their positions and velocities accordingly.

constructor.name: Emitter
constructor.description: Emitter is a lightweight particle emitter that uses Arcade Physics.It can be used for one-time explosions or for continuous effects like rain and fire.All it really does is launch Particle objects out at set intervals, and fixes their positions and velocities accordingly.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: Current game instance.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x coordinate within the Emitter that the particles are emitted from.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y coordinate within the Emitter that the particles are emitted from.

parameters.name: maxParticles
parameters.description: The total number of particles in this emitter.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Called automatically by the game loop, decides when to launch particles and when to "die".

functions.name: makeParticles
functions.description: This function generates a new set of particles for use by this emitter.The particles are stored internally waiting to be emitted via Emitter.start.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: A string or an array of strings that the particle sprites will use as their texture. If an array one is picked at random.

parameters.name: frames
parameters.description: A frame number, or array of frames that the sprite will use. If an array one is picked at random.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of particles to generate. If not given it will use the value of Emitter.maxParticles. If the value is greater than Emitter.maxParticles it will use Emitter.maxParticles as the quantity.

parameters.name: collide
parameters.description: If you want the particles to be able to collide with other Arcade Physics bodies then set this to true.

parameters.name: collideWorldBounds
parameters.description: A particle can be set to collide against the World bounds automatically and rebound back into the World if this is set to true. Otherwise it will leave the World.

returns.description: This Emitter instance.

functions.name: kill
functions.description: Call this function to turn off all the particles and the emitter.

functions.name: revive
functions.description: Handy for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true.

functions.name: explode
functions.description: Call this function to emit the given quantity of particles at all once (an explosion)

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.description: How long each particle lives once emitted in ms. 0 = forever.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: How many particles to launch.

functions.name: flow
functions.description: Call this function to start emitting a flow of particles at the given frequency.It will carry on going until the total given is reached.Each time the flow is run the quantity number of particles will be emitted together.If you set the total to be 20 and quantity to be 5 then flow will emit 4 times in total (4 x 5 = 20 total)If you set the total to be -1 then no quantity cap is used and it will keep emitting.

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.description: How long each particle lives once emitted in ms. 0 = forever.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description: Frequency is how often to emit the particles, given in ms.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: How many particles to launch each time the frequency is met. Can never be > Emitter.maxParticles.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: How many particles to launch in total. If -1 it will carry on indefinitely.

parameters.name: immediate
parameters.description: Should the flow start immediately (true) or wait until the first frequency event? (false)

functions.name: start
functions.description: Call this function to start emitting particles.

parameters.name: explode
parameters.description: Whether the particles should all burst out at once (true) or at the frequency given (false).

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.description: How long each particle lives once emitted in ms. 0 = forever.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description: Ignored if Explode is set to true. Frequency is how often to emit 1 particle. Value given in ms.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: How many particles to launch. 0 = "all of the particles" which will keep emitting until Emitter.maxParticles is reached.

parameters.name: forceQuantity
parameters.description: If `true` and creating a particle flow, the quantity emitted will be forced to the be quantity given in this call. This can never exceed Emitter.maxParticles.

functions.name: emitParticle
functions.description: This function can be used both internally and externally to emit the next particle in the queue.

returns.description: True if a particle was emitted, otherwise false.

functions.name: destroy
functions.description: Destroys this Emitter, all associated child Particles and then removes itself from the Particle Manager.

functions.name: setSize
functions.description: A more compact way of setting the width and height of the emitter.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The desired width of the emitter (particles are spawned randomly within these dimensions).

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The desired height of the emitter.

functions.name: setXSpeed
functions.description: A more compact way of setting the X velocity range of the emitter.

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: The minimum value for this range.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The maximum value for this range.

functions.name: setYSpeed
functions.description: A more compact way of setting the Y velocity range of the emitter.

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: The minimum value for this range.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The maximum value for this range.

functions.name: setRotation
functions.description: A more compact way of setting the angular velocity constraints of the particles.

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: The minimum value for this range.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The maximum value for this range.

functions.name: setAlpha
functions.description: A more compact way of setting the alpha constraints of the particles.The rate parameter, if set to a value above zero, lets you set the speed at which the Particle change in alpha from min to max.If rate is zero, which is the default, the particle won't change alpha - instead it will pick a random alpha between min and max on emit.

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: The minimum value for this range.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The maximum value for this range.

parameters.name: rate
parameters.description: The rate (in ms) at which the particles will change in alpha from min to max, or set to zero to pick a random alpha between the two.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: If you've set a rate > 0 this is the easing formula applied between the min and max values.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: If you've set a rate > 0 you can set if the ease will yoyo or not (i.e. ease back to its original values)

functions.name: setScale
functions.description: A more compact way of setting the scale constraints of the particles.The rate parameter, if set to a value above zero, lets you set the speed and ease which the Particle uses to change in scale from min to max across both axis.If rate is zero, which is the default, the particle won't change scale during update, instead it will pick a random scale between min and max on emit.

parameters.name: minX
parameters.description: The minimum value of Particle.scale.x.

parameters.name: maxX
parameters.description: The maximum value of Particle.scale.x.

parameters.name: minY
parameters.description: The minimum value of Particle.scale.y.

parameters.name: maxY
parameters.description: The maximum value of Particle.scale.y.

parameters.name: rate
parameters.description: The rate (in ms) at which the particles will change in scale from min to max, or set to zero to pick a random size between the two.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: If you've set a rate > 0 this is the easing formula applied between the min and max values.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: If you've set a rate > 0 you can set if the ease will yoyo or not (i.e. ease back to its original values)

functions.name: at
functions.description: Change the emitters center to match the center of any object with a `center` property, such as a Sprite.If the object doesn't have a center property it will be set to object.x + object.width / 2

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The object that you wish to match the center with.

functions.name: add
functions.description: Adds an existing object as the top child in this group.The child is automatically added to the top of the group and is displayed on top of every previous child.If Group.enableBody is set then a physics body will be created on the object, so long as one does not already exist.Use {@link Phaser.Group#addAt addAt} to control where a child is added. Use {@link Phaser.Group#create create} to create and add a new child.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The display object to add as a child.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

functions.name: addToHash
functions.description: Adds a child of this Group into the hash array.This call will return false if the child is not a child of this Group, or is already in the hash.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The display object to add to this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group already and not present in the hash.

returns.description: True if the child was successfully added to the hash, otherwise false.

functions.name: removeFromHash
functions.description: Removes a child of this Group from the hash array.This call will return false if the child is not in the hash.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The display object to remove from this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group and in the hash.

returns.description: True if the child was successfully removed from the hash, otherwise false.

functions.name: addMultiple
functions.description: Adds an array of existing Display Objects to this Group.The Display Objects are automatically added to the top of this Group, and will render on-top of everything already in this Group.As well as an array you can also pass another Group as the first argument. In this case all of the children from thatGroup will be removed from it and added into this Group.

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: An array of display objects or a Phaser.Group. If a Group is given then *all* children will be moved from it.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.

returns.description: The array of children or Group of children that were added to this Group.

functions.name: addAt
functions.description: Adds an existing object to this group.The child is added to the group at the location specified by the index value, this allows you to control child ordering.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The display object to add as a child.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index within the group to insert the child to.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

functions.name: getAt
functions.description: Returns the child found at the given index within this group.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to return the child from.

returns.description: The child that was found at the given index, or -1 for an invalid index.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new Phaser.Sprite object and adds it to the top of this group.Use {@link Phaser.Group#classType classType} to change the type of object creaded.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the group.x point.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the group.y point.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.description: The default exists state of the Sprite.

returns.description: The child that was created: will be a {@link Phaser.Sprite} unless {@link #classType} has been changed.

functions.name: createMultiple
functions.description: Creates multiple Phaser.Sprite objects and adds them to the top of this group.Useful if you need to quickly generate a pool of identical sprites, such as bullets.By default the sprites will be set to not exist and will be positioned at 0, 0 (relative to the group.x/y).Use {@link Phaser.Group#classType classType} to change the type of object created.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of Sprites to create.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.description: The default exists state of the Sprite.

functions.name: updateZ
functions.description: Internal method that re-applies all of the children's Z values.This must be called whenever children ordering is altered so that their `z` indices are correctly updated.

functions.name: resetCursor
functions.description: Sets the group cursor to the first child in the group.If the optional index parameter is given it sets the cursor to the object at that index instead.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Set the cursor to point to a specific index.

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

functions.name: next
functions.description: Advances the group cursor to the next (higher) object in the group.If the cursor is at the end of the group (top child) it is moved the start of the group (bottom child).

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

functions.name: previous
functions.description: Moves the group cursor to the previous (lower) child in the group.If the cursor is at the start of the group (bottom child) it is moved to the end (top child).

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

functions.name: swap
functions.description: Swaps the position of two children in this group.Both children must be in this group, a child cannot be swapped with itself, and unparented children cannot be swapped.

parameters.name: child1
parameters.description: The first child to swap.

parameters.name: child2
parameters.description: The second child to swap.

functions.name: bringToTop
functions.description: Brings the given child to the top of this group so it renders above all other children.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to bring to the top of this group.

returns.description: The child that was moved.

functions.name: sendToBack
functions.description: Sends the given child to the bottom of this group so it renders below all other children.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to send to the bottom of this group.

returns.description: The child that was moved.

functions.name: moveUp
functions.description: Moves the given child up one place in this group unless it's already at the top.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to move up in the group.

returns.description: The child that was moved.

functions.name: moveDown
functions.description: Moves the given child down one place in this group unless it's already at the bottom.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to move down in the group.

returns.description: The child that was moved.

functions.name: xy
functions.description: Positions the child found at the given index within this group to the given x and y coordinates.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the child in the group to set the position of.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The new x position of the child.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The new y position of the child.

functions.name: reverse
functions.description: Reverses all children in this group.This operaation applies only to immediate children and does not propagate to subgroups.

functions.name: getIndex
functions.description: Get the index position of the given child in this group, which should match the child's `z` property.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to get the index for.

returns.description: The index of the child or -1 if it's not a member of this group.

functions.name: replace
functions.description: Replaces a child of this group with the given newChild. The newChild cannot be a member of this group.

parameters.name: oldChild
parameters.description: The child in this group that will be replaced.

parameters.name: newChild
parameters.description: The child to be inserted into this group.

returns.description: Returns the oldChild that was replaced within this group.

functions.name: hasProperty
functions.description: Checks if the child has the given property.Will scan up to 4 levels deep only.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to check for the existance of the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: An array of strings that make up the property.

returns.description: True if the child has the property, otherwise false.

functions.name: setProperty
functions.description: Sets a property to the given value on the child. The operation parameter controls how the value is set.The operations are:- 0: set the existing value to the given value; if force is `true` a new property will be created if needed- 1: will add the given value to the value already present.- 2: will subtract the given value from the value already present.- 3: will multiply the value already present by the given value.- 4: will divide the value already present by the given value.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to set the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.description: True if the property was set, false if not.

functions.name: checkProperty
functions.description: Checks a property for the given value on the child.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to check the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

returns.description: True if the property was was equal to value, false if not.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Quickly set a property on a single child of this group to a new value.The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to set the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If set then the child will only be updated if alive=true.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If set then the child will only be updated if visible=true.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.description: True if the property was set, false if not.

functions.name: setAll
functions.description: Quickly set the same property across all children of this group to a new value.This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this group, the property will be set on the group but not its children.If you need that ability please see `Group.setAllChildren`.The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

functions.name: setAllChildren
functions.description: Quickly set the same property across all children of this group, and any child Groups, to a new value.If this group contains other Groups then the same property is set across their children as well, iterating down until it reaches the bottom.Unlike with `setAll` the property is NOT set on child Groups itself.The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

functions.name: checkAll
functions.description: Quickly check that the same property across all children of this group is equal to the given value.This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this group, the property will be checked on the group but not its children.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

functions.name: addAll
functions.description: Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this group.`Group.addAll('x', 10)` will add 10 to the child.x value for each child.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to increment, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to increment the property by. If child.x = 10 then addAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

functions.name: subAll
functions.description: Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this group.`Group.subAll('x', 10)` will minus 10 from the child.x value for each child.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to decrement, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to subtract from the property. If child.x = 50 then subAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 10.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

functions.name: multiplyAll
functions.description: Multiplies the given property by the amount on all children in this group.`Group.multiplyAll('x', 2)` will x2 the child.x value for each child.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to multiply, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to multiply the property by. If child.x = 10 then multiplyAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 20.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

functions.name: divideAll
functions.description: Divides the given property by the amount on all children in this group.`Group.divideAll('x', 2)` will half the child.x value for each child.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

functions.name: callAllExists
functions.description: Calls a function, specified by name, on all children in the group who exist (or do not exist).After the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the function on the children to call.

parameters.name: existsValue
parameters.description: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.

functions.name: callbackFromArray
functions.description: Returns a reference to a function that exists on a child of the group based on the given callback array.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The object to inspect.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The array of function names.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: The size of the array (pre-calculated in callAll).

functions.name: callAll
functions.description: Calls a function, specified by name, on all on children.The function is called for all children regardless if they are dead or alive (see callAllExists for different options).After the method parameter and context you can add as many extra parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Name of the function on the child to call. Deep property lookup is supported.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: A string containing the context under which the method will be executed. Set to null to default to the child.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the method.

functions.name: preUpdate
functions.description: The core preUpdate - as called by World.

functions.name: postUpdate
functions.description: The core postUpdate - as called by World.

functions.name: filter
functions.description: Find children matching a certain predicate.For example:    var healthyList = Group.filter(function(child, index, children) {        return child.health > 10 ? true : false;    }, true);    healthyList.callAll('attack');Note: Currently this will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.description: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.description: If true, only existing can be selected; otherwise all children can be selected and will be passed to the predicate.

returns.description: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

functions.name: forEach
functions.description: Call a function on each child in this group.Additional arguments for the callback can be specified after the `checkExists` parameter. For example,    Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)would invoke `awardBonusGold` function with the parameters `(child, 100, 500)`.Note: This check will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.description: If set only children matching for which `exists` is true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.

functions.name: forEachExists
functions.description: Call a function on each existing child in this group.See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.

functions.name: forEachAlive
functions.description: Call a function on each alive child in this group.See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.

functions.name: forEachDead
functions.description: Call a function on each dead child in this group.See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.

functions.name: sort
functions.description: Sort the children in the group according to a particular key and ordering.Call this function to sort the group according to a particular key value and order.For example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The name of the property to sort on. Defaults to the objects z-depth value.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order ascending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING SORT_ASCENDING}) or descending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_DESCENDING SORT_DESCENDING}).

functions.name: customSort
functions.description: Sort the children in the group according to custom sort function.The `sortHandler` is provided the two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b).It should return -1 if `a > b`, 1 if `a < b` or 0 if `a === b`.

parameters.name: sortHandler
parameters.description: The custom sort function.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context in which the sortHandler is called.

functions.name: ascendingSortHandler
functions.description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The second object being sorted.

functions.name: descendingSortHandler
functions.description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The second object being sorted.

functions.name: iterate
functions.description: Iterates over the children of the group performing one of several actions for matched children.A child is considered a match when it has a property, named `key`, whose value is equal to `value`according to a strict equality comparison.The result depends on the `returnType`:- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL RETURN_TOTAL}:    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. The number of matched children is returned.- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE RETURN_NONE}:    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. No value is returned.- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD RETURN_CHILD}:    The callback, if any, is applied to the *first* matching child and the *first* matched child is returned.    If there is no matching child then null is returned.If `args` is specified it must be an array. The matched child will be assigned to the firstelement and the entire array will be applied to the callback function.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: A child matches if `child[key] === value` is true.

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.description: How to iterate the children and what to return.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. The matched child is supplied as the first argument.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: The arguments supplied to to the callback; the first array index (argument) will be replaced with the matched child.

returns.description: Returns either an integer (for RETURN_TOTAL), the first matched child (for RETURN_CHILD), or null.

functions.name: getFirstExists
functions.description: Get the first display object that exists, or doesn't exist.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.description: If true, find the first existing child; otherwise find the first non-existing child.

returns.description: The first child, or null if none found.

functions.name: getFirstAlive
functions.description: Get the first child that is alive (`child.alive === true`).This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first alive child, or null if none found.

functions.name: getFirstDead
functions.description: Get the first child that is dead (`child.alive === false`).This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first dead child, or null if none found.

functions.name: getTop
functions.description: Return the child at the top of this group.The top child is the child displayed (rendered) above every other child.

returns.description: The child at the top of the Group.

functions.name: getBottom
functions.description: Returns the child at the bottom of this group.The bottom child the child being displayed (rendered) below every other child.

returns.description: The child at the bottom of the Group.

functions.name: countLiving
functions.description: Get the number of living children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as alive.

functions.name: countDead
functions.description: Get the number of dead children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as dead.

functions.name: getRandom
functions.description: Returns a random child from the group.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Offset from the front of the front of the group (lowest child).

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.description: A random child of this Group.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes the given child from this group.This will dispatch an `onRemovedFromGroup` event from the child (if it has one), and optionally destroy the child.If the group cursor was referring to the removed child it is updated to refer to the next child.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The child to remove.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on the removed child.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the the child will not dispatch the `onRemovedFromGroup` event.

returns.description: true if the child was removed from this group, otherwise false.

functions.name: moveAll
functions.description: Moves all children from this Group to the Group given.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The new Group to which the children will be moved to.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event for the new Group.

returns.description: The Group to which all the children were moved.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Removes all children from this group, but does not remove the group from its parent.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.

functions.name: removeBetween
functions.description: Removes all children from this group whose index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The index to start removing children from.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: The index to stop removing children at. Must be higher than startIndex. If undefined this method will remove all children between startIndex and the end of the group.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.

functions.name: addChild
functions.description: Adds a child to the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to add to the container

returns.description: The child that was added.

parameters.name: index

returns.description: The child that was added.

functions.name: getChildAt
functions.description: Returns the child at the specified index

parameters.name: index

returns.description: The child at the given index, if any.

functions.name: removeChild
functions.description: Removes a child from the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.description: The DisplayObject to remove

functions.name: removeChildAt

functions.name: removeChildren

parameters.name: beginIndex

parameters.name: endIndex

functions.name: getBounds

Useful function that returns a texture of the displayObject object that can then be used to create sprites

members.name: maxParticles
members.description: The total number of particles in this emitter.

members.name: name
members.description: A handy string name for this emitter. Can be set to anything.

members.name: type
members.description: Internal Phaser Type value.

members.name: physicsType
members.description: The const physics body type of this object.

members.name: area
members.description: The area of the emitter. Particles can be randomly generated from anywhere within this rectangle.

members.name: minParticleSpeed
members.description: The minimum possible velocity of a particle.

members.name: maxParticleSpeed
members.description: The maximum possible velocity of a particle.

members.name: minParticleScale
members.description: The minimum possible scale of a particle. This is applied to the X and Y axis. If you need to control each axis see minParticleScaleX.

members.name: maxParticleScale
members.description: The maximum possible scale of a particle. This is applied to the X and Y axis. If you need to control each axis see maxParticleScaleX.

members.name: scaleData
members.description: An array of the calculated scale easing data applied to particles with scaleRates > 0.

members.name: minRotation
members.description: The minimum possible angular velocity of a particle.

members.name: maxRotation
members.description: The maximum possible angular velocity of a particle.

members.name: minParticleAlpha
members.description: The minimum possible alpha value of a particle.

members.name: maxParticleAlpha
members.description: The maximum possible alpha value of a particle.

members.name: alphaData
members.description: An array of the calculated alpha easing data applied to particles with alphaRates > 0.

members.name: gravity
members.description: Sets the `body.gravity.y` of each particle sprite to this value on launch.

members.name: particleClass
members.description: For emitting your own particle class types. They must extend Phaser.Particle.

members.name: particleDrag
members.description: The X and Y drag component of particles launched from the emitter.

members.name: angularDrag
members.description: The angular drag component of particles launched from the emitter if they are rotating.

members.name: frequency
members.description: How often a particle is emitted in ms (if emitter is started with Explode === false).

members.name: lifespan
members.description: How long each particle lives once it is emitted in ms. Default is 2 seconds. Set lifespan to 'zero' for particles to live forever.

members.name: bounce
members.description: How much each particle should bounce on each axis. 1 = full bounce, 0 = no bounce.

members.name: on
members.description: Determines whether the emitter is currently emitting particles. It is totally safe to directly toggle this.

members.name: particleAnchor
members.description: When a particle is created its anchor will be set to match this Point object (defaults to x/y: 0.5 to aid in rotation)

members.name: blendMode
members.description: The blendMode as set on the particle when emitted from the Emitter. Defaults to NORMAL. Needs browser capable of supporting canvas blend-modes (most not available in WebGL)

members.name: emitX
members.description: The point the particles are emitted from.Emitter.x and Emitter.y control the containers location, which updates all current particlesEmitter.emitX and Emitter.emitY control the emission location relative to the x/y position.

members.name: emitY
members.description: The point the particles are emitted from.Emitter.x and Emitter.y control the containers location, which updates all current particlesEmitter.emitX and Emitter.emitY control the emission location relative to the x/y position.

members.name: autoScale
members.description: When a new Particle is emitted this controls if it will automatically scale in size. Use Emitter.setScale to configure.

members.name: autoAlpha
members.description: When a new Particle is emitted this controls if it will automatically change alpha. Use Emitter.setAlpha to configure.

members.name: particleBringToTop
members.description: If this is `true` then when the Particle is emitted it will be bought to the top of the Emitters display list.

members.name: particleSendToBack
members.description: If this is `true` then when the Particle is emitted it will be sent to the back of the Emitters display list.

members.name: _minParticleScale
members.description: Internal particle scale var.

members.name: _maxParticleScale
members.description: Internal particle scale var.

members.name: _quantity
members.description: Internal helper for deciding how many particles to launch.

members.name: _timer
members.description: Internal helper for deciding when to launch particles or kill them.

members.name: _counter
members.description: Internal counter for figuring out how many particles to launch.

members.name: _flowQuantity
members.description: Internal counter for figuring out how many particles to launch per flow update.

members.name: _flowTotal
members.description: Internal counter for figuring out how many particles to launch in total.

members.name: _explode
members.description: Internal helper for the style of particle emission (all at once, or one at a time).

members.name: _frames
members.description: Internal helper for the particle frame.

members.name: width
members.description: Gets or sets the width of the Emitter. This is the region in which a particle can be emitted.

members.name: height
members.description: Gets or sets the height of the Emitter. This is the region in which a particle can be emitted.

members.name: x
members.description: Gets or sets the x position of the Emitter.

members.name: y
members.description: Gets or sets the y position of the Emitter.

members.name: left
members.description: Gets the left position of the Emitter.

members.name: right
members.description: Gets the right position of the Emitter.

members.name: top
members.description: Gets the top position of the Emitter.

members.name: bottom
members.description: Gets the bottom position of the Emitter.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running Game.

members.name: z
members.description: The z-depth value of this object within its parent container/Group - the World is a Group as well.This value must be unique for each child in a Group.

members.name: alive
members.description: The alive property is useful for Groups that are children of other Groups and need to be included/excluded in checks like forEachAlive.

members.name: exists
members.description: If exists is true the group is updated, otherwise it is skipped.

members.name: ignoreDestroy
members.description: A group with `ignoreDestroy` set to `true` ignores all calls to its `destroy` method.

members.name: pendingDestroy
members.description: A Group is that has `pendingDestroy` set to `true` is flagged to have its destroy method called on the next logic update.You can set it directly to flag the Group to be destroyed on its next update.This is extremely useful if you wish to destroy a Group from within one of its own callbacks or a callback of one of its children.

members.name: classType
members.description: The type of objects that will be created when using {@link Phaser.Group#create create} or {@link Phaser.Group#createMultiple createMultiple}.Any object may be used but it should extend either Sprite or Image and accept the same constructor arguments:when a new object is created it is passed the following parameters to its constructor: `(game, x, y, key, frame)`.

members.name: cursor
members.description: The current display object that the group cursor is pointing to, if any. (Can be set manually.)The cursor is a way to iterate through the children in a Group using {@link Phaser.Group#next next} and {@link Phaser.Group#previous previous}.

members.name: enableBody
members.description: If true all Sprites created by, or added to this group, will have a physics body enabled on them.The default body type is controlled with {@link Phaser.Group#physicsBodyType physicsBodyType}.

members.name: enableBodyDebug
members.description: If true when a physics body is created (via {@link Phaser.Group#enableBody enableBody}) it will create a physics debug object as well.This only works for P2 bodies.

members.name: physicsBodyType
members.description: If {@link Phaser.Group#enableBody enableBody} is true this is the type of physics body that is created on new Sprites.The valid values are {@link Phaser.Physics.ARCADE}, {@link Phaser.Physics.P2}, {@link Phaser.Physics.NINJA}, etc.

members.name: physicsSortDirection
members.description: If this Group contains Arcade Physics Sprites you can set a custom sort direction via this property.It should be set to one of the Phaser.Physics.Arcade sort direction constants: Phaser.Physics.Arcade.SORT_NONEPhaser.Physics.Arcade.LEFT_RIGHTPhaser.Physics.Arcade.RIGHT_LEFTPhaser.Physics.Arcade.TOP_BOTTOMPhaser.Physics.Arcade.BOTTOM_TOPIf set to `null` the Group will use whatever Phaser.Physics.Arcade.sortDirection is set to. This is the default behavior.

members.name: onDestroy
members.description: This signal is dispatched when the group is destroyed.

members.name: cursorIndex
members.description: The current index of the Group cursor. Advance it with Group.next.

members.name: fixedToCamera
members.description: A Group that is fixed to the camera uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera. These are stored in Group.cameraOffset.Note that the cameraOffset values are in addition to any parent in the display list.So if this Group was in a Group that has x: 200, then this will be added to the cameraOffset.x

members.name: cameraOffset
members.description: If this object is {@link Phaser.Group#fixedToCamera fixedToCamera} then this stores the x/y position offset relative to the top-left of the camera view.If the parent of this Group is also `fixedToCamera` then the offset here is in addition to that and should typically be disabled.

members.name: hash
members.description: The hash array is an array belonging to this Group into which you can add any of its children via Group.addToHash and Group.removeFromHash.Only children of this Group can be added to and removed from the hash.This hash is used automatically by Phaser Arcade Physics in order to perform non z-index based destructive sorting.However if you don't use Arcade Physics, or this isn't a physics enabled Group, then you can use the hash to perform your ownsorting and filtering of Group children without touching their z-index (and therefore display draw order)

members.name: _sortProperty
members.description: The property on which children are sorted.

members.name: total
members.description: Total number of existing children in the group.

members.name: length
members.description: Total number of children in this group, regardless of exists/alive status.

members.name: angle
members.description: The angle of rotation of the group container, in degrees.This adjusts the group itself by modifying its local rotation transform.This has no impact on the rotation/angle properties of the children, but it will update their worldTransformand on-screen orientation and position.

members.name: rotation
members.description: The angle of rotation of the group container, in radians.This will adjust the group container itself by modifying its rotation.This will have no impact on the rotation value of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

members.name: visible
members.description: The visible state of the group. Non-visible Groups and all of their children are not rendered.

members.name: alpha
members.description: The alpha value of the group container.

members.name: children
members.description: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

members.name: position
members.description: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

members.name: scale
members.description: The scale factor of the object.

members.name: transformCallback
members.description:
The transform callback is an optional callback that if set will be called at the end of the updateTransform method and sent two parameters:
This Display Objects worldTransform matrix and its parents transform matrix. Both are PIXI.Matrix object types.
The matrix are passed by reference and can be modified directly without needing to return them.
This ability allows you to check any of the matrix values and perform actions such as clamping scale or limiting rotation, regardless of the parent transforms.

members.name: transformCallbackContext
members.description: The context under which the transformCallback is invoked.

members.name: pivot
members.description: The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around

members.name: hitArea
members.description:
This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.
Setting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

members.name: renderable
members.description: Can this object be rendered

members.name: parent
members.description: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.

members.name: stage
members.description: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

members.name: worldAlpha
members.description: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

members.name: worldTransform
members.description: [read-only] Current transform of the object based on world (parent) factors

members.name: worldPosition
members.description:
The position of the Display Object based on the world transform.
This value is updated at the end of updateTransform and takes all parent transforms into account.

members.name: worldScale
members.description:
The scale of the Display Object based on the world transform.
This value is updated at the end of updateTransform and takes all parent transforms into account.

members.name: worldRotation
members.description:
The rotation of the Display Object, in radians, based on the world transform.
This value is updated at the end of updateTransform and takes all parent transforms into account.

members.name: _sr
members.description: cached sin rotation and cos rotation

members.name: _cr
members.description: cached sin rotation and cos rotation

members.name: filterArea
members.description:
The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation
rather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

members.name: _bounds
members.description: The original, cached bounds of the object

members.name: _currentBounds
members.description: The most up-to-date bounds of the object

members.name: _mask
members.description: The original, cached mask of the object

members.name: _cacheAsBitmap
members.description: Cached internal flag.

members.name: _cacheIsDirty
members.description: Cached internal flag.

members.name: worldVisible
members.description: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

members.name: mask
members.description:
Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.
In PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.
To remove a mask, set this property to null.

members.name: filters
members.description:
Sets the filters for the displayObject.
IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the Canvas renderer.

To remove filters simply set this property to 'null'.

You cannot have a filter and a multiply blend mode active at the same time. Setting a filter will reset
this objects blend mode to NORMAL.

members.name: cacheAsBitmap
members.description:
Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.
This basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.
To remove simply set this property to 'null'

classes.name: Phaser.Physics.Arcade.Body
classes.description: The Physics Body is linked to a single Sprite. All physics operations should be performed against the body rather thanthe Sprite itself. For example you can set the velocity, acceleration, bounce values etc all on the Body.

constructor.name: Body
constructor.description: The Physics Body is linked to a single Sprite. All physics operations should be performed against the body rather thanthe Sprite itself. For example you can set the velocity, acceleration, bounce values etc all on the Body.

parameters.name: sprite
parameters.description: The Sprite object this physics body belongs to.

functions.description: Internal method.

functions.description: Internal method.

functions.description: Removes this bodys reference to its parent sprite, freeing it up for gc.

functions.description: Internal method.

functions.name: setSize
functions.description: You can modify the size of the physics Body to be any dimension you need.So it could be smaller or larger than the parent Sprite. You can also control the x and y offset, whichis the position of the Body relative to the top-left of the Sprite.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the Body.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the Body.

parameters.name: offsetX
parameters.description: The X offset of the Body from the Sprite position.

parameters.name: offsetY
parameters.description: The Y offset of the Body from the Sprite position.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets all Body values (velocity, acceleration, rotation, etc)

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The new x position of the Body.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The new y position of the Body.

functions.name: hitTest
functions.description: Tests if a world point lies within this Body.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The world x coordinate to test.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The world y coordinate to test.

returns.description: True if the given coordinates are inside this Body, otherwise false.

functions.name: onFloor
functions.description: Returns true if the bottom of this Body is in contact with either the world bounds or a tile.

returns.description: True if in contact with either the world bounds or a tile.

functions.name: onWall
functions.description: Returns true if either side of this Body is in contact with either the world bounds or a tile.

returns.description: True if in contact with either the world bounds or a tile.

functions.name: deltaAbsX
functions.description: Returns the absolute delta x value.

returns.description: The absolute delta value.

functions.name: deltaAbsY
functions.description: Returns the absolute delta y value.

returns.description: The absolute delta value.

functions.name: deltaX
functions.description: Returns the delta x value. The difference between Body.x now and in the previous step.

returns.description: The delta value. Positive if the motion was to the right, negative if to the left.

functions.name: deltaY
functions.description: Returns the delta y value. The difference between Body.y now and in the previous step.

returns.description: The delta value. Positive if the motion was downwards, negative if upwards.

functions.name: deltaZ
functions.description: Returns the delta z value. The difference between Body.rotation now and in the previous step.

returns.description: The delta value. Positive if the motion was clockwise, negative if anti-clockwise.

members.name: sprite
members.description: Reference to the parent Sprite.

members.name: game
members.description: Local reference to game.

members.name: type
members.description: The type of physics system this body belongs to.

members.name: enable
members.description: A disabled body won't be checked for any form of collision or overlap or have its pre/post updates run.

members.name: offset
members.description: The offset of the Physics Body from the Sprite x/y position.

members.name: position
members.description: The position of the physics body.

members.name: prev
members.description: The previous position of the physics body.

members.name: allowRotation
members.description: Allow this Body to be rotated? (via angularVelocity, etc)

members.name: rotation
members.description: An Arcade Physics Body can have angularVelocity and angularAcceleration. Please understand that the collision Bodyitself never rotates, it is always axis-aligned. However these values are passed up to the parent Sprite and updates its rotation.

members.name: preRotation
members.description: The previous rotation of the physics body.

members.name: width
members.description: The calculated width of the physics body.

members.name: height
members.description: The calculated height of the physics body.

members.name: sourceWidth
members.description: The un-scaled original size.

members.name: sourceHeight
members.description: The un-scaled original size.

members.name: halfWidth
members.description: The calculated width / 2 of the physics body.

members.name: halfHeight
members.description: The calculated height / 2 of the physics body.

members.name: center
members.description: The center coordinate of the Physics Body.

members.name: velocity
members.description: The velocity, or rate of change in speed of the Body. Measured in pixels per second.

members.name: newVelocity
members.description: The new velocity. Calculated during the Body.preUpdate and applied to its position.

members.name: deltaMax
members.description: The Sprite position is updated based on the delta x/y values. You can set a cap on those (both +-) using deltaMax.

members.name: acceleration
members.description: The acceleration is the rate of change of the velocity. Measured in pixels per second squared.

members.name: drag
members.description: The drag applied to the motion of the Body.

members.name: allowGravity
members.description: Allow this Body to be influenced by gravity? Either world or local.

members.name: gravity
members.description: A local gravity applied to this Body. If non-zero this over rides any world gravity, unless Body.allowGravity is set to false.

members.name: bounce
members.description: The elasticity of the Body when colliding. bounce.x/y = 1 means full rebound, bounce.x/y = 0.5 means 50% rebound velocity.

members.name: maxVelocity
members.description: The maximum velocity in pixels per second sq. that the Body can reach.

members.name: friction
members.description: The amount of movement that will occur if another object 'rides' this one.

members.name: angularVelocity
members.description: The angular velocity controls the rotation speed of the Body. It is measured in radians per second.

members.name: angularAcceleration
members.description: The angular acceleration is the rate of change of the angular velocity. Measured in radians per second squared.

members.name: angularDrag
members.description: The drag applied during the rotation of the Body.

members.name: maxAngular
members.description: The maximum angular velocity in radians per second that the Body can reach.

members.name: mass
members.description: The mass of the Body. When two bodies collide their mass is used in the calculation to determine the exchange of velocity.

members.name: angle
members.description: The angle of the Body in radians, as calculated by its angularVelocity.

members.name: speed
members.description: The speed of the Body as calculated by its velocity.

members.name: facing
members.description: A const reference to the direction the Body is traveling or facing.

members.name: immovable
members.description: An immovable Body will not receive any impacts from other bodies.

members.name: moves
members.description: If you have a Body that is being moved around the world via a tween or a Group motion, but its local x/y position neveractually changes, then you should set Body.moves = false. Otherwise it will most likely fly off the screen.If you want the physics system to move the body around, then set moves to true. Set to true to allow the Physics system to move this Body, otherwise false to move it manually.

members.name: customSeparateX
members.description: This flag allows you to disable the custom x separation that takes place by Physics.Arcade.separate.Used in combination with your own collision processHandler you can create whatever type of collision response you need. Use a custom separation system or the built-in one?

members.name: customSeparateY
members.description: This flag allows you to disable the custom y separation that takes place by Physics.Arcade.separate.Used in combination with your own collision processHandler you can create whatever type of collision response you need. Use a custom separation system or the built-in one?

members.name: overlapX
members.description: When this body collides with another, the amount of overlap is stored here. The amount of horizontal overlap during the collision.

members.name: overlapY
members.description: When this body collides with another, the amount of overlap is stored here. The amount of vertical overlap during the collision.

members.name: embedded
members.description: If a body is overlapping with another body, but neither of them are moving (maybe they spawned on-top of each other?) this is set to true. Body embed value.

members.name: collideWorldBounds
members.description: A Body can be set to collide against the World bounds automatically and rebound back into the World if this is set to true. Otherwise it will leave the World. Should the Body collide with the World bounds?

members.name: checkCollision
members.description: Set the checkCollision properties to control which directions collision is processed for this Body.For example checkCollision.up = false means it won't collide when the collision happened while moving up. An object containing allowed collision.

members.name: touching
members.description: This object is populated with boolean values when the Body collides with another.touching.up = true means the collision happened to the top of this Body for example. An object containing touching results.

members.name: wasTouching
members.description: This object is populated with previous touching values from the bodies previous collision. An object containing previous touching results.

members.name: blocked
members.description: This object is populated with boolean values when the Body collides with the World bounds or a Tile.For example if blocked.up is true then the Body cannot move up. An object containing on which faces this Body is blocked from moving, if any.

members.name: tilePadding
members.description: If this is an especially small or fast moving object then it can sometimes skip over tilemap collisions if it moves through a tile in a step.Set this padding value to add extra padding to its bounds. tilePadding.x applied to its width, y to its height. Extra padding to be added to this sprite's dimensions when checking for tile collision.

members.name: dirty
members.description: If this Body in a preUpdate (true) or postUpdate (false) state?

members.name: skipQuadTree
members.description: If true and you collide this Sprite against a Group, it will disable the collision check from using a QuadTree.

members.name: syncBounds
members.description: If true the Body will check itself against the Sprite.getBounds() dimensions and adjust its width and height accordingly.If false it will compare its dimensions against the Sprite scale instead, and adjust its width height if the scale has changed.Typically you would need to enable syncBounds if your sprite is the child of a responsive display object such as a FlexLayer, or in any situation where the Sprite scale doesn't change, but its parents scale is effecting the dimensions regardless.

classes.name: Phaser.Physics.Arcade
classes.description: The Arcade Physics world. Contains Arcade Physics related collision, overlap and motion methods.

constructor.name: Arcade
constructor.description: The Arcade Physics world. Contains Arcade Physics related collision, overlap and motion methods.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: reference to the current game instance.

functions.description: Updates the size of this physics world.
