classes.name: Phaser.Tween
classes.description: A Tween allows you to alter one or more properties of a target object over a defined period of time.This can be used for things such as alpha fading Sprites, scaling them or motion.Use `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` to set-up the tween values. You can create multiple tweens on the same objectby calling Tween.to multiple times on the same Tween. Additional tweens specified in this way become "child" tweens andare played through in sequence. You can use Tween.timeScale and Tween.reverse to control the playback of this Tween and all of its children.

constructor.name: Tween
constructor.description: A Tween allows you to alter one or more properties of a target object over a defined period of time.This can be used for things such as alpha fading Sprites, scaling them or motion.Use `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` to set-up the tween values. You can create multiple tweens on the same objectby calling Tween.to multiple times on the same Tween. Additional tweens specified in this way become "child" tweens andare played through in sequence. You can use Tween.timeScale and Tween.reverse to control the playback of this Tween and all of its children.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target object, such as a Phaser.Sprite or Phaser.Sprite.scale.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: Current game instance.

parameters.name: manager
parameters.description: The TweenManager responsible for looking after this Tween.

functions.name: to
functions.description: Sets this tween to be a `to` tween on the properties given. A `to` tween starts at the current value and tweens to the destination value given.For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 could be tweened to `x` 200 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 200 }`.The ease function allows you define the rate of change. You can pass either a function such as Phaser.Easing.Circular.Out or a string such as "Circ".".easeIn", ".easeOut" and "easeInOut" variants are all supported for all ease types.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: An object containing the properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration of this tween in ms. Or if `Tween.frameBased` is true this represents the number of frames that should elapse.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden.

parameters.name: autoStart
parameters.description: Set to `true` to allow this tween to start automatically. Otherwise call Tween.start().

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Delay before this tween will start in milliseconds. Defaults to 0, no delay.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This only effects this induvidual tween, not any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: from
functions.description: Sets this tween to be a `from` tween on the properties given. A `from` tween sets the target to the destination value and tweens to its current value.For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 tweened from `x` 500 would be set to `x` 500 and then tweened to `x` 100 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 500 }`.The ease function allows you define the rate of change. You can pass either a function such as Phaser.Easing.Circular.Out or a string such as "Circ".".easeIn", ".easeOut" and "easeInOut" variants are all supported for all ease types.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: An object containing the properties you want to tween., such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration of this tween in ms. Or if `Tween.frameBased` is true this represents the number of frames that should elapse.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden.

parameters.name: autoStart
parameters.description: Set to `true` to allow this tween to start automatically. Otherwise call Tween.start().

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Delay before this tween will start in milliseconds. Defaults to 0, no delay.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This only effects this induvidual tween, not any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Starts the tween running. Can also be called by the autoStart parameter of `Tween.to` or `Tween.from`.This sets the `Tween.isRunning` property to `true` and dispatches a `Tween.onStart` signal.If the Tween has a delay set then nothing will start tweening until the delay has expired.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this Tween contains child tweens you can specify which one to start from. The default is zero, i.e. the first tween created.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stops the tween if running and flags it for deletion from the TweenManager.If called directly the `Tween.onComplete` signal is not dispatched and no chained tweens are started unless the complete parameter is set to `true`.If you just wish to pause a tween then use Tween.pause instead.

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: Set to `true` to dispatch the Tween.onComplete signal.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: updateTweenData
functions.description: Updates either a single TweenData or all TweenData objects properties to the given value.Used internally by methods like Tween.delay, Tween.yoyo, etc. but can also be called directly if you know which property you want to tweak.The property is not checked, so if you pass an invalid one you'll generate a run-time error.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to update.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set the property to.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the delay on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: delay
functions.description: Sets the delay in milliseconds before this tween will start. If there are child tweens it sets the delay before the first child starts.The delay is invoked as soon as you call `Tween.start`. If the tween is already running this method doesn't do anything for the current active tween.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to delay.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the delay across all of them.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The amount of time in ms that the Tween should wait until it begins once started is called. Set to zero to remove any active delay.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the delay on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: repeat
functions.description: Sets the number of times this tween will repeat.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to repeat.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the number of times they'll repeat across all of them.If you wish to define how many times this Tween and all children will repeat see Tween.repeatAll.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: How many times a tween should repeat before completing. Set to zero to remove an active repeat. Set to -1 to repeat forever.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: This is the amount of time to pause (in ms) before the repeat will start.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the repeat value on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: repeatDelay
functions.description: Sets the delay in milliseconds before this tween will repeat itself.The repeatDelay is invoked as soon as you call `Tween.start`. If the tween is already running this method doesn't do anything for the current active tween.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to set repeatDelay on.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the repeatDelay across all of them.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The amount of time in ms that the Tween should wait until it repeats or yoyos once start is called. Set to zero to remove any active repeatDelay.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the repeatDelay on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: yoyo
functions.description: A Tween that has yoyo set to true will run through from its starting values to its end values and then play back in reverse from end to start.Used in combination with repeat you can create endless loops.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to yoyo.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the yoyo property across all of them.If you wish to yoyo this Tween and all of its children then see Tween.yoyoAll.

parameters.name: enable
parameters.description: Set to true to yoyo this tween, or false to disable an already active yoyo.

parameters.name: yoyoDelay
parameters.description: This is the amount of time to pause (in ms) before the yoyo will start.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set yoyo on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: yoyoDelay
functions.description: Sets the delay in milliseconds before this tween will run a yoyo (only applies if yoyo is enabled).The repeatDelay is invoked as soon as you call `Tween.start`. If the tween is already running this method doesn't do anything for the current active tween.If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to set repeatDelay on.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the repeatDelay across all of them.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The amount of time in ms that the Tween should wait until it repeats or yoyos once start is called. Set to zero to remove any active yoyoDelay.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the yoyoDelay on all the children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: easing
functions.description: Set easing function this tween will use, i.e. Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.The ease function allows you define the rate of change. You can pass either a function such as Phaser.Easing.Circular.Out or a string such as "Circ".".easeIn", ".easeOut" and "easeInOut" variants are all supported for all ease types.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the easing function defined here across all of them.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: The easing function this tween will use, i.e. Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the easing function on all children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: interpolation
functions.description: Sets the interpolation function the tween will use. By default it uses Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation.Also available: Phaser.Math.bezierInterpolation and Phaser.Math.catmullRomInterpolation.The interpolation function is only used if the target properties is an array.If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value and it will set the interpolation function across all of them.

parameters.name: interpolation
parameters.description: The interpolation function to use (Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation by default)

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context under which the interpolation function will be run.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the interpolation function on all children.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: repeat
functions.description: Set how many times this tween and all of its children will repeat.A tween (A) with 3 children (B,C,D) with a `repeatAll` value of 2 would play as: ABCDABCD before completing.When all child tweens have completed Tween.onLoop will be dispatched.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: How many times this tween and all children should repeat before completing. Set to zero to remove an active repeat. Set to -1 to repeat forever.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: chain
functions.description: This method allows you to chain tweens together. Any tween chained to this tween will have its `Tween.start` method calledas soon as this tween completes. If this tween never completes (i.e. repeatAll or loop is set) then the chain will never progress.Note that `Tween.onComplete` will fire when *this* tween completes, not when the whole chain completes.For that you should listen to `onComplete` on the final tween in your chain.If you pass multiple tweens to this method they will be joined into a single long chain.For example if this is Tween A and you pass in B, C and D then B will be chained to A, C will be chained to B and D will be chained to C.Any previously chained tweens that may have been set will be overwritten.

parameters.name: tweens
parameters.description: One or more tweens that will be chained to this one.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: loop
functions.description: Enables the looping of this tween and all child tweens. If this tween has no children this setting has no effect.If `value` is `true` then this is the same as setting `Tween.repeatAll(-1)`.If `value` is `false` it is the same as setting `Tween.repeatAll(0)` and will reset the `repeatCounter` to zero.Usage:game.add.tween(p).to({ x: 700 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None, true).to({ y: 300 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None).to({ x: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None).to({ y: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None).loop();

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: If `true` this tween and any child tweens will loop once they reach the end. Set to `false` to remove an active loop.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: onUpdateCallback
functions.description: Sets a callback to be fired each time this tween updates.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback to invoke each time this tween is updated. Set to `null` to remove an already active callback.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.description: The context in which to call the onUpdate callback.

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

functions.name: pause
functions.description: Pauses the tween. Resume playback with Tween.resume.

functions.name: _pause
functions.description: This is called by the core Game loop. Do not call it directly, instead use Tween.pause.

functions.name: resume
functions.description: Resumes a paused tween.

functions.name: _resume
functions.description: This is called by the core Game loop. Do not call it directly, instead use Tween.pause.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Core tween update function called by the TweenManager. Does not need to be invoked directly.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: A timestamp passed in by the TweenManager.

returns.description: false if the tween and all child tweens have completed and should be deleted from the manager, otherwise true (still active).

functions.name: generateData
functions.description: This will generate an array populated with the tweened object values from start to end.It works by running the tween simulation at the given frame rate based on the values set-up in Tween.to and Tween.from.It ignores delay and repeat counts and any chained tweens, but does include child tweens.Just one play through of the tween data is returned, including yoyo if set.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: The speed in frames per second that the data should be generated at. The higher the value, the larger the array it creates.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: If given the generated data will be appended to this array, otherwise a new array will be returned.

returns.description: An array of tweened values.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running Game.

members.name: target
members.description: The target object, such as a Phaser.Sprite or property like Phaser.Sprite.scale.

members.name: manager
members.description: Reference to the TweenManager responsible for updating this Tween.

members.name: timeline
members.description: An Array of TweenData objects that comprise the different parts of this Tween.

members.name: reverse
members.description: If set to `true` the current tween will play in reverse.If the tween hasn't yet started this has no effect.If there are child tweens then all child tweens will play in reverse from the current point.

members.name: timeScale
members.description: The speed at which the tweens will run. A value of 1 means it will match the game frame rate. 0.5 will run at half the frame rate. 2 at double the frame rate, etc.If a tweens duration is 1 second but timeScale is 0.5 then it will take 2 seconds to complete.

members.name: repeatCounter
members.description: If the Tween and any child tweens are set to repeat this contains the current repeat count.

members.name: pendingDelete
members.description: True if this Tween is ready to be deleted by the TweenManager.

members.name: onStart
members.description: The onStart event is fired when the Tween begins. If there is a delay before the tween starts then onStart fires after the delay is finished.It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: onLoop
members.description: The onLoop event is fired if the Tween or any child tween loops.It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: onRepeat
members.description: The onRepeat event is fired if the Tween and all of its children repeats. If this tween has no children this will never be fired.It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: onChildComplete
members.description: The onChildComplete event is fired when the Tween or any of its children completes.Fires every time a child completes unless a child is set to repeat forever.It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: onComplete
members.description: The onComplete event is fired when the Tween and all of its children completes. Does not fire if the Tween is set to loop or repeatAll(-1).It will be sent 2 parameters: the target object and this tween.

members.name: isRunning
members.description: If the tween is running this is set to true, otherwise false. Tweens that are in a delayed state or waiting to start are considered as being running.

members.name: current
members.description: The current Tween child being run.

members.name: properties
members.description: Target property cache used when building the child data values.

members.name: chainedTween
members.description: If this Tween is chained to another this holds a reference to it.

members.name: isPaused
members.description: Is this Tween paused or not?

members.name: frameBased
members.description: Is this Tween frame or time based? A frame based tween will use the physics elapsed timer when updating. This meansit will retain the same consistent frame rate, regardless of the speed of the device. The duration value given shouldbe given in frames.If the Tween uses a time based update (which is the default) then the duration is given in milliseconds.In this situation a 2000ms tween will last exactly 2 seconds, regardless of the device and how many visual updates the tweenhas actually been through. For very short tweens you may wish to experiment with a frame based update instead.The default value is whatever you've set in TweenManager.frameBased.

members.name: _onUpdateCallback
members.description: An onUpdate callback.

members.name: _onUpdateCallbackContext
members.description: The context in which to call the onUpdate callback.

members.name: _pausedTime
members.description: Private pause timer.

members.name: _codePaused
members.description: Was the Tween paused by code or by Game focus loss?

members.name: _hasStarted
members.description: Internal var to track if the Tween has started yet or not.

members.name: totalDuration
members.description: Gets the total duration of this Tween, including all child tweens, in milliseconds.

classes.name: Phaser.TweenData
classes.description: A Phaser.Tween contains at least one TweenData object. It contains all of the tween data values, such as thestarting and ending values, the ease function, interpolation and duration. The Tween acts as a timeline manager forTweenData objects and can contain multiple TweenData objects.

constructor.name: TweenData
constructor.description: A Phaser.Tween contains at least one TweenData object. It contains all of the tween data values, such as thestarting and ending values, the ease function, interpolation and duration. The Tween acts as a timeline manager forTweenData objects and can contain multiple TweenData objects.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The Tween that owns this TweenData object.

functions.name: to
functions.description: Sets this tween to be a `to` tween on the properties given. A `to` tween starts at the current value and tweens to the destination value given.For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 could be tweened to `x` 200 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 200 }`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration of this tween in ms.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden at will.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Delay before this tween will start, defaults to 0 (no delay). Value given is in ms.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This ignores any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: from
functions.description: Sets this tween to be a `from` tween on the properties given. A `from` tween sets the target to the destination value and tweens to its current value.For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 tweened from `x` 500 would be set to `x` 500 and then tweened to `x` 100 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 500 }`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration of this tween in ms.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden at will.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Delay before this tween will start, defaults to 0 (no delay). Value given is in ms.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This ignores any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Starts the Tween running.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: loadValues
functions.description: Loads the values from the target object into this Tween.

returns.description: This Tween object.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates this Tween. This is called automatically by Phaser.Tween.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: A timestamp passed in by the Tween parent.

returns.description: The current status of this Tween. One of the Phaser.TweenData constants: PENDING, RUNNING, LOOPED or COMPLETE.

functions.name: generateData
functions.description: This will generate an array populated with the tweened object values from start to end.It works by running the tween simulation at the given frame rate based on the values set-up in Tween.to and Tween.from.Just one play through of the tween data is returned, including yoyo if set.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: The speed in frames per second that the data should be generated at. The higher the value, the larger the array it creates.

returns.description: An array of tweened values.

functions.name: repeat
functions.description: Checks if this Tween is meant to repeat or yoyo and handles doing so.

returns.description: Either Phaser.TweenData.LOOPED or Phaser.TweenData.COMPLETE.

members.name: parent
members.description: The Tween which owns this TweenData.

members.name: game
members.description: A reference to the currently running Game.

members.name: vStart
members.description: An object containing the values at the start of the tween.

members.name: vStartCache
members.description: Cached starting values.

members.name: vEnd
members.description: An object containing the values at the end of the tween.

members.name: vEndCache
members.description: Cached ending values.

members.name: duration
members.description: The duration of the tween in ms.

members.name: percent
members.description: A value between 0 and 1 that represents how far through the duration this tween is.

members.name: value
members.description: The current calculated value.

members.name: repeatCounter
members.description: If the Tween is set to repeat this contains the current repeat count.

members.name: repeatDelay
members.description: The amount of time in ms between repeats of this tween.

members.name: interpolate
members.description: True if the Tween will use interpolation (i.e. is an Array to Array tween)

members.name: yoyo
members.description: True if the Tween is set to yoyo, otherwise false.

members.name: yoyoDelay
members.description: The amount of time in ms between yoyos of this tween.

members.name: inReverse
members.description: When a Tween is yoyoing this value holds if it's currently playing forwards (false) or in reverse (true).

members.name: delay
members.description: The amount to delay by until the Tween starts (in ms). Only applies to the start, use repeatDelay to handle repeats.

members.name: dt
members.description: Current time value.

members.name: startTime
members.description: The time the Tween started or null if it hasn't yet started.

members.name: easingFunction
members.description: The easing function used for the Tween.

members.name: interpolationFunction
members.description: The interpolation function used for the Tween.

members.name: interpolationContext
members.description: The interpolation function context used for the Tween.

members.name: isRunning
members.description: If the tween is running this is set to `true`. Unless Phaser.Tween a TweenData that is waiting for a delay to expire is *not* considered as running.

members.name: isFrom
members.description: Is this a from tween or a to tween?

classes.name: Phaser.TweenManager
classes.description: Phaser.Game has a single instance of the TweenManager through which all Tween objects are created and updated.Tweens are hooked into the game clock and pause system, adjusting based on the game state.TweenManager is based heavily on tween.js by http://soledadpenades.com.The difference being that tweens belong to a games instance of TweenManager, rather than to a global TWEEN object.It also has callbacks swapped for Signals and a few issues patched with regard to properties and completion errors.Please see https://github.com/sole/tween.js for a full list of contributors.

constructor.name: TweenManager
constructor.description: Phaser.Game has a single instance of the TweenManager through which all Tween objects are created and updated.Tweens are hooked into the game clock and pause system, adjusting based on the game state.TweenManager is based heavily on tween.js by http://soledadpenades.com.The difference being that tweens belong to a games instance of TweenManager, rather than to a global TWEEN object.It also has callbacks swapped for Signals and a few issues patched with regard to properties and completion errors.Please see https://github.com/sole/tween.js for a full list of contributors.

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: A reference to the currently running game.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Get all the tween objects in an array.

returns.description: Array with all tween objects.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Remove all tweens running and in the queue. Doesn't call any of the tween onComplete events.

functions.name: removeFrom
functions.description: Remove all tweens from a specific object, array of objects or Group.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object you want to remove the tweens from.

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: If passing a group, setting this to true will remove the tweens from all of its children instead of the group itself.

functions.name: add
functions.description: Add a new tween into the TweenManager.

parameters.name: tween
parameters.description: The tween object you want to add.

returns.description: The tween object you added to the manager.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Create a tween object for a specific object. The object can be any JavaScript object or Phaser object such as Sprite.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: Object the tween will be run on.

returns.description: The newly created tween object.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove a tween from this manager.

parameters.name: tween
parameters.description: The tween object you want to remove.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Update all the tween objects you added to this manager.

returns.description: Return false if there's no tween to update, otherwise return true.

functions.name: isTweening
functions.description: Checks to see if a particular Sprite is currently being tweened.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The object to check for tweens against.

returns.description: Returns true if the object is currently being tweened, false if not.

functions.name: _pauseAll
functions.description: Private. Called by game focus loss. Pauses all currently running tweens.

functions.name: _resumeAll
functions.description: Private. Called by game focus loss. Resumes all currently paused tweens.

functions.name: pauseAll
functions.description: Pauses all currently running tweens.

functions.name: resumeAll
functions.description: Resumes all currently paused tweens.

members.name: game
members.description: Local reference to game.

members.name: frameBased
members.description: Are all newly created Tweens frame or time based? A frame based tween will use the physics elapsed timer when updating. This meansit will retain the same consistent frame rate, regardless of the speed of the device. The duration value given shouldbe given in frames.If the Tween uses a time based update (which is the default) then the duration is given in milliseconds.In this situation a 2000ms tween will last exactly 2 seconds, regardless of the device and how many visual updates the tweenhas actually been through. For very short tweens you may wish to experiment with a frame based update instead.

members.name: _tweens
members.description: All of the currently running tweens.

members.name: _add
members.description: All of the tweens queued to be added in the next update.

classes.name: Phaser.ArraySet
classes.description: ArraySet is a Set data structure (items must be unique within the set) that also maintains order.This allows specific items to be easily added or removed from the Set.Item equality (and uniqueness) is determined by the behavior of `Array.indexOf`.This used primarily by the Input subsystem.

constructor.name: ArraySet
constructor.description: ArraySet is a Set data structure (items must be unique within the set) that also maintains order.This allows specific items to be easily added or removed from the Set.Item equality (and uniqueness) is determined by the behavior of `Array.indexOf`.This used primarily by the Input subsystem.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: The backing array: if specified the items in the list _must_ be unique, per `Array.indexOf`, and the ownership of the array _should_ be relinquished to the ArraySet.

functions.name: add
functions.description: Adds a new element to the end of the list.If the item already exists in the list it is not moved.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The element to add to this list.

returns.description: The item that was added.

functions.name: getIndex
functions.description: Gets the index of the item in the list, or -1 if it isn't in the list.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The element to get the list index for.

returns.description: The index of the item or -1 if not found.

functions.name: getByKey
functions.description: Gets an item from the set based on the property strictly equaling the value given.Returns null if not found.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to check against the value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to check if the property strictly equals.

returns.description: The item that was found, or null if nothing matched.

functions.name: exists
functions.description: Checks for the item within this list.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The element to get the list index for.

returns.description: True if the item is found in the list, otherwise false.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Removes all the items.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes the given element from this list if it exists.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to be removed from the list.

returns.description: item - The item that was removed.

functions.name: setAll
functions.description: Sets the property `key` to the given value on all members of this list.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The property of the item to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set the property to.

functions.name: callAll
functions.description: Calls a function on all members of this list, using the member as the context for the callback.If the `key` property is present it must be a function.The function is invoked using the item as the context.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The name of the property with the function to call.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Removes every member from this ArraySet and optionally destroys it.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: Call `destroy` on each member as it's removed from this set.

members.name: position
members.description: Current cursor position as established by `first` and `next`.

members.name: list
members.description: The backing array.

members.name: total
members.description: Number of items in the ArraySet. Same as `list.length`.

members.name: first
members.description: Returns the first item and resets the cursor to the start.

members.name: next
members.description: Returns the the next item (based on the cursor) and advances the cursor.

classes.name: Phaser.ArrayUtils
classes.description: Utility functions for dealing with Arrays.

constructor.name: ArrayUtils
constructor.description: Utility functions for dealing with Arrays.

functions.name: getRandomItem
functions.description: Fetch a random entry from the given array.Will return null if there are no array items that fall within the specified rangeor if there is no item for the randomly chosen index.

parameters.name: objects
parameters.description: An array of objects.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.description: The random object that was selected.

functions.name: removeRandomItem
functions.description: Removes a random object from the given array and returns it.Will return null if there are no array items that fall within the specified rangeor if there is no item for the randomly chosen index.

parameters.name: objects
parameters.description: An array of objects.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.description: The random object that was removed.

functions.name: shuffle
functions.description: A standard Fisher-Yates Array shuffle implementation which modifies the array in place.

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: The array to shuffle.

returns.description: The original array, now shuffled.

functions.name: transposeMatrix
functions.description: Transposes the elements of the given matrix (array of arrays).

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: The matrix to transpose.

returns.description: A new transposed matrix

functions.name: rotateMatrix
functions.description: Rotates the given matrix (array of arrays).Based on the routine from {@link http://jsfiddle.net/MrPolywhirl/NH42z/}.

parameters.name: matrix
parameters.description: The array to rotate; this matrix _may_ be altered.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The amount to rotate: the rotation in degrees (90, -90, 270, -270, 180) or a string command ('rotateLeft', 'rotateRight' or 'rotate180').

returns.description: The rotated matrix. The source matrix should be discarded for the returned matrix.

functions.name: findClosest
functions.description: Snaps a value to the nearest value in an array.The result will always be in the range `[first_value, last_value]`.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The search value

parameters.name: arr
parameters.description: The input array which _must_ be sorted.

returns.description: The nearest value found.

functions.name: rotate
functions.description: Moves the element from the start of the array to the end, shifting all items in the process.The "rotation" happens to the left.

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: The array to shift/rotate. The array is modified.

returns.description: The shifted value.

functions.name: numberArray
functions.description: Create an array representing the inclusive range of numbers (usually integers) in `[start, end]`.This is equivalent to `numberArrayStep(start, end, 1)`.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The minimum value the array starts with.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The maximum value the array contains.

returns.description: The array of number values.

functions.name: numberArrayStep
functions.description: Create an array of numbers (positive and/or negative) progressing from `start`up to but not including `end` by advancing by `step`.If `start` is less than `end` a zero-length range is created unless a negative `step` is specified.Certain values for `start` and `end` (eg. NaN/undefined/null) are currently coerced to 0;for forward compatibility make sure to pass in actual numbers.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start of the range.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end of the range.

parameters.name: step
parameters.description: The value to increment or decrement by.

returns.description: Returns the new array of numbers.

classes.name: Phaser.Color
classes.description: The Phaser.Color class is a set of static methods that assist in color manipulation and conversion.

constructor.name: Color
constructor.description: The Phaser.Color class is a set of static methods that assist in color manipulation and conversion.

functions.name: packPixel
functions.description: Packs the r, g, b, a components into a single integer, for use with Int32Array.If device is little endian then ABGR order is used. Otherwise RGBA order is used.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.

returns.description: The packed color as uint32

functions.name: unpackPixel
functions.description: Unpacks the r, g, b, a components into the specified color object, or a newobject, for use with Int32Array. If little endian, then ABGR order is used whenunpacking, otherwise, RGBA order is used. The resulting color object has the`r, g, b, a` properties which are unrelated to endianness.Note that the integer is assumed to be packed in the correct endianness. On little-endianthe format is 0xAABBGGRR and on big-endian the format is 0xRRGGBBAA. If you want aendian-independent method, use fromRGBA(rgba) and toRGBA(r, g, b, a).

parameters.name: rgba
parameters.description: The integer, packed in endian order by packPixel.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.

parameters.name: hsl
parameters.description: Also convert the rgb values into hsl?

parameters.name: hsv
parameters.description: Also convert the rgb values into hsv?

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

functions.name: fromRGBA
functions.description: A utility to convert an integer in 0xRRGGBBAA format to a color object.This does not rely on endianness.

parameters.name: rgba
parameters.description: An RGBA hex

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: The object to use, optional.

returns.description: A color object.

functions.name: toRGBA
functions.description: A utility to convert RGBA components to a 32 bit integer in RRGGBBAA format.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.

returns.description: A RGBA-packed 32 bit integer

functions.name: RGBtoHSL
functions.description: Converts an RGB color value to HSL (hue, saturation and lightness).Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.Assumes RGB values are contained in the set [0, 255] and returns h, s and l in the set [0, 1].Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created, h, s and l. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the hue, saturation and lightness values set in the h, s and l properties.

functions.name: HSLtoRGB
functions.description: Converts an HSL (hue, saturation and lightness) color value to RGB.Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.Assumes HSL values are contained in the set [0, 1] and returns r, g and b values in the set [0, 255].Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

parameters.name: h
parameters.description: The hue, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The saturation, in the range 0 - 1.

parameters.name: l

functions.name: RGBtoHSV

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created, h, s and v. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the hue, saturation and value set in the h, s and v properties.

functions.name: HSVtoRGB

functions.name: hexToColor
functions.description: Converts a hex string into a Phaser Color object.The hex string can supplied as `'#0033ff'` or the short-hand format of `'#03f'`; it can begin with an optional "#" or "0x", or be unprefixed.    An alpha channel is _not_ supported.

parameters.name: hex
parameters.description: The color string in a hex format.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created or set: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

functions.name: webToColor
functions.description: Converts a CSS 'web' string into a Phaser Color object.The web string can be in the format `'rgb(r,g,b)'` or `'rgba(r,g,b,a)'` where r/g/b are in the range [0..255] and a is in the range [0..1].

parameters.name: web
parameters.description: The color string in CSS 'web' format.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: An object into which 4 properties will be created: r, g, b and a. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: An object with the red, green, blue and alpha values set in the r, g, b and a properties.

functions.name: valueToColor
functions.description: Converts a value - a "hex" string, a "CSS 'web' string", or a number - into red, green, blue, and alpha components.The value can be a string (see `hexToColor` and `webToColor` for the supported formats) or a packed integer (see `getRGB`).An alpha channel is _not_ supported when specifying a hex string.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The color expressed as a recognized string format or a packed integer.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: The object to use for the output. If not provided a new object will be created.

returns.description: The (`out`) object with the red, green, blue, and alpha values set as the r/g/b/a properties.

functions.name: componentToHex

parameters.name: color

functions.name: blendNormal
functions.description: Blends the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendLighten
functions.description: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendDarken
functions.description: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendMultiply
functions.description: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values.The result color is always at least as dark as either of the two constituentcolors. Multiplying any color with black produces black;multiplying with white leaves the original color unchanged.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendAverage
functions.description: Takes the average of the source and backdrop colors.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendAdd
functions.description: Adds the source and backdrop colors together and returns the value, up to a maximum of 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendSubtract
functions.description: Combines the source and backdrop colors and returns their value minus 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendDifference
functions.description: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter.Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendNegation
functions.description: Negation blend mode.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendScreen
functions.description: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors. Screening any color with white produces white; screening with black leaves the original color unchanged.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendExclusion
functions.description: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode, but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendOverlay
functions.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color.Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced, but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendSoftLight
functions.description: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. If the source color is lighter than 0.5, the backdrop is lightened, as if it were dodged; this is useful for adding highlights to a scene. If the source color is darker than 0.5, the backdrop is darkened, as if it were burned in. The degree of lightening or darkening is proportional to the difference between the source color and 0.5; if it is equal to 0.5, the backdrop is unchanged.Painting with pure black or white produces a distinctly darker or lighter area, but does not result in pure black or white. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendHardLight
functions.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. If the source color is lighter than 0.5, the backdrop is lightened, as if it were screened; this is useful for adding highlights to a scene. If the source color is darker than 0.5, the backdrop is darkened, as if it were multiplied; this is useful for adding shadows to a scene. The degree of lightening or darkening is proportional to the difference between the source color and 0.5; if it is equal to 0.5, the backdrop is unchanged.Painting with pure black or white produces pure black or white. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendColorDodge
functions.description: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendColorBurn
functions.description: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.Painting with white produces no change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendLinearDodge
functions.description: An alias for blendAdd, it simply sums the values of the two colors.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendLinearBurn
functions.description: An alias for blendSubtract, it simply sums the values of the two colors and subtracts 255.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendLinearLight
functions.description: This blend mode combines Linear Dodge and Linear Burn (rescaled so that neutral colors become middle gray).Dodge applies to values of top layer lighter than middle gray, and burn to darker values.The calculation simplifies to the sum of bottom layer and twice the top layer, subtract 128. The contrast decreases.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendVividLight
functions.description: This blend mode combines Color Dodge and Color Burn (rescaled so that neutral colors become middle gray).Dodge applies when values in the top layer are lighter than middle gray, and burn to darker values.The middle gray is the neutral color. When color is lighter than this, this effectively moves the white point of the bottom layer down by twice the difference; when it is darker, the black point is moved up by twice the difference. The perceived contrast increases.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendPinLight
functions.description: If the backdrop color (light source) is lighter than 50%, the blendDarken mode is used, and colors lighter than the backdrop color do not change.If the backdrop color is darker than 50% gray, colors lighter than the blend color are replaced, and colors darker than the blend color do not change.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendHardMix
functions.description: Runs blendVividLight on the source and backdrop colors.If the resulting color is 128 or more, it receives a value of 255; if less than 128, a value of 0.Therefore, all blended pixels have red, green, and blue channel values of either 0 or 255.This changes all pixels to primary additive colors (red, green, or blue), white, or black.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendReflect
functions.description: Reflect blend mode. This mode is useful when adding shining objects or light zones to images.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendGlow
functions.description: Glow blend mode. This mode is a variation of reflect mode with the source and backdrop colors swapped.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

functions.name: blendPhoenix
functions.description: Phoenix blend mode. This subtracts the lighter color from the darker color, and adds 255, giving a bright result.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

classes.name: Phaser.Utils.Debug
classes.description: A collection of methods for displaying debug information about game objects.If your game is running in WebGL then Debug will create a Sprite that is placed at the top of the Stage display list and bind a canvas textureto it, which must be uploaded every frame. Be advised: this is very expensive, especially in browsers like Firefox. So please only enable Debugin WebGL mode if you really need it (or your desktop can cope with it well) and disable it for production!If your game is using a Canvas renderer then the debug information is literally drawn on the top of the active game canvas and no Sprite is used.

constructor.name: Debug
constructor.description: A collection of methods for displaying debug information about game objects.If your game is running in WebGL then Debug will create a Sprite that is placed at the top of the Stage display list and bind a canvas textureto it, which must be uploaded every frame. Be advised: this is very expensive, especially in browsers like Firefox. So please only enable Debugin WebGL mode if you really need it (or your desktop can cope with it well) and disable it for production!If your game is using a Canvas renderer then the debug information is literally drawn on the top of the active game canvas and no Sprite is used.

classes.name: Phaser.LinkedList
classes.description: A basic Linked List data structure.This implementation _modifies_ the `prev` and `next` properties of each item added:- The `prev` and `next` properties must be writable and should not be used for any other purpose.- Items _cannot_ be added to multiple LinkedLists at the same time.- Only objects can be added.

constructor.name: LinkedList
constructor.description: A basic Linked List data structure.This implementation _modifies_ the `prev` and `next` properties of each item added:- The `prev` and `next` properties must be writable and should not be used for any other purpose.- Items _cannot_ be added to multiple LinkedLists at the same time.- Only objects can be added.

functions.name: add
functions.description: Adds a new element to this linked list.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The element to add to this list. Can be a Phaser.Sprite or any other object you need to quickly iterate through.

returns.description: The item that was added.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets the first, last, next and previous node pointers in this list.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes the given element from this linked list if it exists.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to be removed from the list.

functions.name: callAll
functions.description: Calls a function on all members of this list, using the member as the context for the callback.The function must exist on the member.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function to call.

members.name: next
members.description: Next element in the list.

members.name: prev
members.description: Previous element in the list.

members.name: first
members.description: First element in the list.

members.name: last
members.description: Last element in the list.

members.name: total
members.description: Number of elements in the list.

functions.name: getProperty

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to traverse.

parameters.name: prop
parameters.description: The property whose value will be returned.

returns.description: the value of the property or null if property isn't found .

functions.name: setProperty
functions.description: Sets an objects property by string.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to traverse

parameters.name: prop
parameters.description: The property whose value will be changed

returns.description: The object on which the property was set.

functions.description: Choose between one of two values randomly.

returns.description: The randomly selected choice

parameters.description: The size to parse.

parameters.description: The window dimension to check.

returns.description: The parsed dimension.

functions.name: pad
functions.description: JavaScript string pad http://www.webtoolkit.info/.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: The target string.

parameters.name: len
parameters.description: The number of characters to be added.

parameters.name: pad
parameters.description: The string to pad it out with (defaults to a space).

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description: The direction dir = 1 (left), 2 (right), 3 (both).

returns.description: The padded string

functions.name: isPlainObject
functions.description: This is a slightly modified version of jQuery.isPlainObject.A plain object is an object whose internal class property is [object Object].

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to inspect.

returns.description: - true if the object is plain, otherwise false.

functions.name: extend
functions.description: This is a slightly modified version of http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.extend/

parameters.name: deep
parameters.description: Perform a deep copy?

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target object to copy to.

returns.description: The extended object.

functions.name: mixinPrototype
functions.description: Mixes in an existing mixin object with the target.Values in the mixin that have either `get` or `set` functions are created as properties via `defineProperty`_except_ if they also define a `clone` method - if a clone method is defined that is called instead andthe result is assigned directly.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target object to receive the new functions.

parameters.name: mixin
parameters.description: The object to copy the functions from.

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: If the target object already has a matching function should it be overwritten or not?

functions.name: mixin
functions.description: Mixes the source object into the destination object, returning the newly modified destination object.Based on original code by @mudcube

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The object to copy (the source object).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The object to copy to (the destination object).

returns.description: The modified destination object.
